loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila L. is a resident of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married, with six children studying at different levels.

She is a good member of Paglaum Cooperative. She is requesting a loan amounting to Php5,000.00 and intends to buy fertilizer and pesticides for corn production.

Cerila is thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help poor people while encouraging them to work hard for their future. She aspires to be able to give their children a good education and future.

loans.use: Purchase corn fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta R. is 43 years old. She is married and has nine children who are studying in different levels. She resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs. She is a member of PMPC-Microfinance.  The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school, earn their degrees and have their own decent lives in the future .

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for hogs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith N. is from Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.  She is 49 years old.  Judith is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Judith owns and operates a "sari-sari" store in the retail sector. While not her only means to generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. 

Judith has engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately Php5,500 a month from these activities.  In 2007, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. 

Judith is requesting a new loan of Php14,900 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her ninth taken out by Judith from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 
-----------------------------------------------
About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Buy goods/products to sell.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalita B. is a bona fide resident of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She has been a regular member of Paglaum Coop since March 13, 2008. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

She is requesting a loan of Php5,000.00 for additional capital to expand her business, which is a sari-sari store. Rosalita wants to expand her business in the future to earn a bigger income, so she can increase her stock and customers. She hopes for her family that she will be able to complete her children's schooling.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock

loans.name: Najmuddin

texts.ru: Самадов Начмуддин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 10 детей. Начмуддин ремонтирует автомашины. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить автозапчасти, для  расширения своей  деятельности. В этом ему помогают старшие сыновья.
texts.en:
Najmuddin S. lives in the Hamadoni region of Tajikistan. He is 47 years old, married and has ten children. Najmuddin has been repairing cars for the last 15 years and his older sons help him in his business. He would like to use this loan to buy spare auto parts for his business, in order to expand the type of repairs he can perform.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Alimad

texts.ru: Алимад Ашуров более 10 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он 8 лет работал по своей специальности шофером. Проживает Алимад в районе Хамадони. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Другой сын помогает отцу. Алимад получает хороший урожай овощей и удовлетворяет потребности своей семьи, а также  половину своего урожая продает на Базаре.
texts.en:
Alimad A. has been farming for over 10 years. Earlier he worked as a professional driver. He lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 50 years old, married, and has four children. His eldest son is working in Russia. Another son helps Alimad. Alimad receives good yields of vegetables; enough for his family and for half of the harvest to be sold at the market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and irrigated land

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Has

texts.en: Has B., 56, lives in Phnom Penh and runs a moto-taxi to earn a living. He is able to make $3 per day. He has been running a moto-taxi business since 2000. His wife, Try Mom, 55, is a clothes seller in the local market. She typically makes $2 per day. This couple has three children; one is a student and two are employed. Mr. Has B. needs a loan of $200 to purchase more clothes for his wife to sell at the market. (Has B. and his wife were not available for the picture so their daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru: Абдулхамид Вохидов более 20 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он работал бухгалтером, т.к. заработная плата не удовлетворяла он начал свой бизнес. Абдулхамид сеет рис, собирает и продает на базаре. Проживает он в районе Хамадони. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Ему по бизнесу также помогают его дети. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы собрать первый урожай и посеить второй. Собрав второй урожай продать его.
texts.en:
Abdulhamid Vahidov has been farming for over 20 years. Before that he worked as an accountant, but began his own business because the salary was too low. Abdulhamid grows rice, harvests, and sells it at the market. He lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 54 years old, married, and has five children, who help with the business. He is requesting a loan for harvest of the first crop and planting of the second. He will sell when the second planting is harvested.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvest and replanting

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 59, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh. Since 2000, he has been running a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make $3 per day. His wife sells newspapers and snow cones in front of her home. She typically makes $3 per day as well. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and two are employed.

To earn more money, Keo S. would like to take out a loan to build rooms to rent out to garment factory workers. This will give his family an additional income.

Note: Keo S. was not available for picture so his wife and his daughter are pictured instead.

loans.use: To build  rooms to rent

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em N., 47, is a widow who lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh. She sells discs from her home and is able to make about $5 per day. She is aided by one of her children who works in a private company. Currently, she is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase more CDs to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more CDs

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Бури Гашбеков проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 63 года. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Бури более 15 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он работал гидротехником. Бури выращивает рис для продажи и для семьи. В этом ему помогают его дети. Клиент просит  у нас кредит, чтобы собрать урожай и посеить второй.
texts.en:
Buri G. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 63 years old, married, and has seven children. Buri has been farming for over 15 years. Before that he worked as a hydraulic engineer. He grows rice for sale and for the family. The children help him with the work. This client is requesting a loan from us to use for gathering the first harvest and planting the second.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and replanting

loans.name: Ysuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Чомадов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Юсуф более 10 лет занимается земледелием. Он сеет урожай риса,  часть продает, а часть оставляет для семьи. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить удобрения для земли. Клиент после применения удобрений может получить хороший урожай, который покроит его расходы, т.к. он планирует продать часть своего урожая населению.
texts.en:
Yusuf J. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Yusuf has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. He plants rice and sells part of it and keeps part of it for his family. The client is asking us for credit in order to purchase fertilizer for his land. The client will be able to get a good harvest after using fertilizer, which will cover his expenses, because he plans to sell part of his harvest to the local population.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen K. is 30 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh city. Since 2005, he has been running a moto-taxi to earn a living and is able to make about US $5 per day, while his wife, pictured here, works as a professional tailor from home. She typically makes about US $2 per day.

This couple has five children, two of whom are students and three are garment factory workers. Ngen K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a new motorbike for his business. The old one is fixed often and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun S. is 49 years old and lives with one of her children in Phnom Penh city. She rents the rooms in her house to earn a living and is able to make US$3 per day. She is also aided by her daughter who works in a garment factory.

Chun S. is asking for a loan to repair rooms so that she can increase the renting price.

loans.use: To repair rooms.

loans.name: Mahmadlatif

texts.ru: Махмадлатиф Собиров проживает в районе Хамадони. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Возраст 44 года. Махмадлатиф более 15 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает рис. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купит удобрения. Собрав урожай и посеить второй. Он планирует продать  часть своего урожая в своем  махали и на базаре.
texts.en:
Mahmadlatif S. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is married and has 4 children. He is 44 years old. Mahmadlatif has worked in agriculture for over 15 years. He grows rice. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer. He will collect the harvest and plant a second one. He plans to sell part of his harvest in his village and at the market.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 44, has been a policeman since 1980. He typically makes US$5 per day. He lives with his wife and three of his children in Phnom Penh city. His wife, pictured here, sells clothes and makes US$5 per day as well. Three of their children are in school.

Ek S. would like to take out a loan to increase the clothing inventory for his wife and the rest will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and renovate house.

loans.name: Teb

texts.en:
Teb P. is 66 years old and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh city. He is a barber and makes US$2 of profit every day. His wife rents rooms and earns US$2 per day as well.

This couple has five children and two of them are local doctors. Teb P. is asking for a loan to repair rooms so that he can increase the renting price.

loans.use: To repair rooms.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S. and his wife, Chorvy Vann, live in Phnom Penh city and opened a small restaurant in their home. They sell roasted beef and pork and wines. This couple typically makes US$10 of profit every day. They have five children, four of them are in school and one helps them to sell food.

In order to increase profits, Kong S. is asking for US$1000 to purchase more beers, chairs, tables and other materials to increase his business. (Chorvy Vann and her daughter are pictured)

loans.use: To purchase more beers, chairs, tables and other materials.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф Гоибов в возрасте 40 лет, проживает в районе Хамадони. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Шариф более 15 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает рис и кукурузу. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить удобрения. После применения может  получить хороший урожай. Шариф хочет продать часть своего урожая населению.
texts.en:
Sharif G. is 40 years old and lives in the Hamadoni region. He is married and has 5 children. Sharif has worked in agriculture for more than 15 years. He grows rice and corn. The client is asking us for credit in order to purchase fertilizer. After using it he will be able to get a good harvest. Sharif would like to sell part of his harvest to the local population.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Valihon

texts.ru: Курбонов Валихон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Валихон более 20 лет занимается земледелием. В этом ему помогают дети. Он в основном выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Клиент получившую сумму будет использовать для сбора  урожая и посева второго урожая. И в дальнейшем продаст собравший урожай.
texts.en:
Valihon K. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Valihon has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. His children help him. He mostly grows rice and sells it at the market. The client will use the received sum to collect a harvest and to plant a second harvest. In the future he will sell the collected harvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant and collect harvest

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Алиев Шариф проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 52 года.  Шариф со своей семьей занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Шариф собрав свой урожай продает его на рынке. Он в основном сажает рис и кукрузу. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы собрать урожай и удовлетворить  потребности своей семьи, а потом посеить  второй урожай  риса и кукурузы, и в зимний период продать его.
texts.en:
Sharif A. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 52 years old. Sharif and his family work in agriculture. They have been in this business for more than 20 years. Sharif after collecting the harvest sells it at the market. He mostly plants rice and corn. The client is asking for credit in order to collect the harvest and satisfy his family’s needs, and to then plant a second harvest of rice and corn and to sell it in the winter season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Collect and plant harvest

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary C., 46 years old, lives at Oroquieta City. She is famous for pillow cases, dress- & curtain-making. She obtained the skills when she was still young with her grandmother being the owner of a fashion design shop. When  she got married, she continued the said business. Her primary customers are her neighbors & relatives. As time goes by, tested & proven over the years that many had known them already, some from banks, teachers and even government employees. In order to cater to them, she hired part time dressmakers and paid them based on the number of pieces. Today, she is applying for PHP5,000 to buy additional fabrics and materials. In the future, she hopes that they might have a registered tailoring shop in the heart of the city.

loans.use: To buy additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Mrs. Shara A. is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a motor cub driver. She has been a member of Paglaum Coop since August 15, 2008 and has good performance in repayments. Currently, she's availing her third cycle of loans in the amount of PHP7,000.00 for additional capital for her existing business which is a sari-sari store.
This loan will be used to expand her business in order to have more income. She dreams of sending her children to school and to finish their studies.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy V. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Juvy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a gardening business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over seven  years and earns approximately PHP5,000 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of PHP14,900 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juvy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn A., a 28-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, is from the village of Anonang where she owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately Php 7,000.00 a month.

In 2009, Edelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of Php 5,000.00 from PMPC, Edelyn is now requesting a new loan of Php 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Forty-five years old, married and blessed with six children who are studying in primary and secondary school, hardworking and determined Mrs. Helen A. is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her husband is a farmer.

Because of the family's abject poverty, Helen started selling fruits and vegetables to their neighbors, relatives and friends. Not having enough capital to start a sari-sari store, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last August 2008 to access a loan for additional capital. Her heart’s desire is to send their children to college and see them become successful in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruits and vegetables vending

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Lilian M., the married mother of four school-aged children, is from the town of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte, where she owns and operates a business growing crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately Php 3,500 a month.

In 2006, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of Php 10,000 from PMPC, used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow, she is now requesting a new loan of Php10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Lilian’s fifth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the resulting additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia B. is a widow with two adult-aged children. Their major source of income is from a motorcycle for hire,  which has an estimated net revenue of Php 3,000 per month. Always hoping to have enough daily savings for their daily living and future, Letecia is now requesting a loan amount of Php 20,000.00 for motorcycle registration and repairs.

loans.use: Body repair of motorcycle and registration

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie L. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She is 47 years old and married, from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Lorie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lorie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lorie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lorie is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and plants. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and plants

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie S. is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is a resident of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. One of her children has already finished college and is presently working as a teacher in their municipality. The family is engaged in farming rice.

Lynie was recognized as a member of PMPC in February, 2003, under the microfinance program PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). She has had six previous loans. Her last loan of 4,500 PHP was used to buy fertilizers and chemicals for their rice field. This loan of 36,000 PHP is to purchase a motorcycle for hire so she could have additional income. It will also be used to transport her daughter to and from the school where she teaches.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia L. is from the town of Aloran. She is 68 years old, married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Porferia owns and operates a gardening business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Porferia has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Porferia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Porferia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and plants. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and plants

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling metal and metal-related products in the local community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They live in the city of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Grace has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grace is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional metal products to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia B. owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from Oroquieta City. Cecelia has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Hardworking and determined, Mrs. Helen J. is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 59 years old, married and has been blessed with four children who are studying in primary and secondary levels. Her husband is a farmer. Her cassava and corn production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to defray operating expenses for her land. She needs to cover farm expenses such as fertilizers and labor costs. She hopes and prays that her business will expand and produce enough savings for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is a 28-year-old tailor who lives in Nyalenda slum in Kisumu and also sells ready-made clothes. Simon is married and has one son, Duncan. He purchases his clothing stock from Nairobi and Busia. Simon does not ascribe fixed prices to his clothes, but, in the tradition of most merchants in Kenya’s markets, negotiates for each item.

The challenges, he says, are stiff competition from other sellers and the ups and downs of Kenya’s economy. It is hard to predict when people will have money here. This is Simon’s first loan, and he plans to use it for more clothing stock and, if he can afford it, new sewing machines for tailoring. As an aside, I asked him who his favorite football team is. Breaking with most Kenyans, he said Barcelona FC instead of Manchester United.

In this video, you can hear me greet Simon saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Simon responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl A. grew up here in Kisumu and runs a juice and yogurt business. She has her own recipe that she describes in this video. She has two employees who help her distribute the juice by going door to door in town. Beryl is a 28-year-old single mother of two children, aged 6 and 4, who, she says, adore her. The challenges she faces are paying her employees when business is slow.

In addition, Beryl says the weather has cooled down here in Kisumu, where the temperature on the day we interviewed her hovered around 80 degrees Fahrenheit. Beryl hopes to use the loan to open up her own canteen where she can serve her juices. This will allow her to stay closer to home while at the same time not having to run her business out of where she lives. She also hopes to employ more people. When asked if men or women make better entrepreneurs, she says women, a common refrain amongst our borrowers.

In this video, you can hear me greet Beryl saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Beryl responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

loans.use: Building Materials, Land, Ingredients

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is a 26-year-old mother of one boy, named Geoffrey. She runs a salon and also sells both ready-made and used clothes, purchased from Busia or Nairobi. She lives in Nyalenda slum and hopes to use the loan to expand her business. The profits will go to support children orphaned by relatives and by neighbors that have passed away. Her main challenges are stiff competition in the market from other clothes-sellers.

Susan likes running her own business because no one restricts her and it gives her freedom. Susan’s hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business so that she can make enough money to support all her children. She is hoping the government will do something for all the orphans she takes care of.

In this video, you can hear me greet Susan saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Susan responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O. is a 33-year-old mother of three children, ages 14, 10, and 7. All are in school and she is married to a police officer. Christine sells charcoal and sometimes makes dresses. She lives next to Nyamasaria slum near a Coptic church. She purchases the charcoal from trucks (lorries) that come around – bringing it from forests near Masi Mara.

Christine also owns six houses that she rents out. She hopes to use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more charcoal to sell. Her hopes for the future are for her business to enlarge and to sell out of a kiosk and maybe even a truck.

In this video, you can hear me greet Christine saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Christine responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." loans.name: Pamela Audi

texts.en:
Pamela Audi A. is a 38-year-old widow asking to receive her first loan. She lives in Nyalenda slum in Kisumu where she raises her eight children. Pamela runs a tailoring shop near her home and averages about ten customers a day. Customers are usually charged around 500 shillings for her services, though Pamela says her main challenge is maintaining a consistent customer base. She will use this loan to buy materials she needs for her business as well as paying school fees for her children.

In this video, you can hear me greet Pamela saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Pamela responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." loans.name: Fidelite

texts.en:
Fidelite A. is a 29-year-old who lives in Nyamasaria and sells both used and ready-made clothes. She purchases her clothing stock either in Kibuye market (Kisumu’s largest open-air market) or Nairobi. She chooses the clothes she sells by looking for what her customers like. Sometimes she will see 10 customers, other days 5 and sometimes no customers come.

Fidelite is married and has one son, age 6, named Frank. Frank says that when he grows up, he would like to be a doctor. Fidelite likes running her own business because it means she does not have to ever go begging to her husband. She likes purchasing things on her own instead of waiting for him. She hopes to use this loan to purchase more clothing stock. Her hopes for the future are to expand her business so that one day she will own her own boutique.

In this video, you can hear me greet Fidelite saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Fidelite responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." loans.name: Margret Adhiambo

texts.en:
Margret Adhiambo A. is a 36-year-old widowed mother of five children – the oldest is 12, the youngest is 3. Her husband passed away and she is raising her children by herself. She is a farmer and lives in Kawese, which is just outside of Kisumu to the Northwest. Margret’s main challenge is finding high quality seeds, which she usually purchases from Agrovet in Kisumu. She wants to use the loan to purchase hybrid seeds and to hire farmhands. She grows vegetables, maize, beans and green grubs. Her hope for the future is to send all her children to school.

In this video, you can hear me greet Margret saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Margret responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." loans.name: Christine Anyango

texts.en:
Christine Anyango O. is a 31-year-old widow who takes care of two children aged 16 ad 14. They are both in school. She sells second-hand clothes, purchased at Kibuye market (Kisumu’s largest open-air market) and sells them by going door to door in Nyamasaria. Her challenges are that there are so many other people also selling used clothes. and the wholesalers have raised the price of bales. Christine has thought about starting a new business to sell vegetables from Nakuru in Kibuye. Her hopes for the future are to have a big business, to send her children to university and to own her own home. In her free-time she likes to watch videos and take her children on little tours.

In this video, you can hear me greet Christine saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Christine responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post.

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work.

loans.name: Beatrice Aseyo

texts.en:
Beatrice Aseyo K. is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She sells maize and cosmetics, purchased from Busia, and sold in Nyamasaria slum. Beatrice’s challenges in business are allowing too many customers to have credit. She does not like collecting debt. Her hope for the future is to have a larger business. In her free-time, Beatrice likes to watch videos and have a few drinks. She hopes to use the loan for selling more goods out of her house.

In this video, you can hear me greet Beatrice saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Beatrice responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. loans.name: Leena Auma

texts.en:
Leena is a 26-year-old woman married to a matatu (a share taxi) driver. They do not have children. Leena runs a video show and sells cereals like maize and beans. She shows Christian movies in a small shop, charging 5 shillings each. The programs usually last one hour.

Leena hopes to use the loan to improve her business by buying a fan for the video shop and a fridge for sodas and water. She says she is not facing any big challenges right now. In her free time, she likes to read storybooks and watch movies. Leena heard about K-MET from her friends.

In this video, you can hear me greet Leena saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Leena responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." You can read more about K-MET’s work here.

loans.use: To buy a fan and a refrigerator.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is a 21-year-old who lives in Nyamasaria slum. He is single and has no children, but does have three brothers. He sells used clothes that he purchases from Kibuye, Kisumu’s largest open-air market. David wants to use the loan to expand his business so that he can brighten his future. His challenges are he sometimes does not make a profit. He hopes that one day he can become a musician, a singer. In his free time, he likes reading storybooks and novels.

In this video, you can hear me greet David saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" David responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. loans.use: To buy clothing stock.

loans.name: Mary Risper

texts.en:
Mary Risper Atieno A. is a 29-year-old widow who takes care of one child, aged seven and a half. She lives in Nyamasaria and runs a butchery where she sells beef. She will use the loan to purchase a cow for slaughter. She can buy a cow for anywhere from 15,000-25,000 KSH. Mary says she can make 2,000-3,000 KSH in profit. In January, Mary was hit by a car and broke her hip. She is still on crutches. This is a big challenge because it is hard for her to check up on her employees. Her hope for the future is to be able to move around again like she used to.

In this video, you can hear me greet Mary saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Mary responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Elizabeth Awuor

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old mother of six children. She is married to a casual worker (similar to a day-laborer in the US). Elizabeth used to run a salon but but now cooks mandazi (a donut-like pastry) because the salon was too expensive to keep up. She hopes to use this loan to re-stock her salon, which she will run out of her house in Nyalenda slum. Elizabeth tells us that she is struggling to pay school fees for her children right now and says if she receives her loan, she will work harder. She says her kids love going to school.

In this video, you can hear me greet Elizabeth saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Elizabeth responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." loans.use: To buy blow dryers, chemicals

loans.name: Scholastica Adhiambo

texts.en:
Scholastica Adhiambo O. is a 32-year-old mother of two children, ages 11 and one, and is married to a businessman. Her family lives in Nyalenda slum in Kisumu. She sells new clothing, purchased from Kampala in the town center at Lake Market. On average, she sees four to five customers a day. She hopes to use the loan to purchase more clothes to stock her shop with.

Scholastica's main challenge is a lack of customers because citizens here in Kisumu are facing hard economic times. Scholastica says August to September are the times when she sells the most clothes. She likes running her own business because she is able to do things herself and nobody controls her. When asked who makes better entrepreneurs, men or women, she says women. This is a common answer, even from the men here in Kisumu because, as Scholastica says, the women care more for the children.

In this video, you can hear me greet Scholastica saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Scholastica responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing stock.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren Ayango N. is a 25-year-old mother of three children. She is married to a lorry driver. Carren runs a small vegetable kiosk in Chiga market in the western end of Kismu. She hopes to use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more stock. She will use the profits to take care of her brothers and sisters who are also orphans, ranging in age from eight to 22. On Fridays, she purchases fruit and vegetables from wholesalers and sells them in Kibuye market, Kisumu’s largest open-air market. Her hope is to find business partners so she can expand her business.

In this video, you can hear me greet Carren saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Carren responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagrosa M. has been selling snacks in her barangay (village) for almost ten years. Her family is also engaged in farming rice fields. She is 55 years old, married and has six children--some are adults. She is a resident of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. M. became a member of the Coop in August, 2005 under the micro-finance program of PMPC called PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). During her membership, she has had nine previous loans, the last one for 5,000 PHP. This loan of 5,000 PHP is for buying ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, vanilla, etc. From the profits, she will buy fertilizers and chemicals for her rice field and cover their daily needs, especially for food.

loans.use: Capital for snack vending business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a resident of Del Pilar, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is already a widow. She has five children. Now, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan for the educational expenses of her child. She is so happy with Paglaum knowing it can provide financial assistance for the education of her children.  Now she is so hopeful that if her daughter will seriously do her part, with hard work and dedication she can finish her studies.

loans.use: For tuition fees

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene T. makes a living primarily from providing motorcycle vehicle services to local community members. She is 26 years old, married and has one small child. She is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. Irene has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia C. is from the town of Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and widowed with three adult children. To make a living, Julia owns and operates a snack-vending business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Julia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Julia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Julia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Mrs. Emma B. is 45 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Currently, she seeks loan of 3,000.00 PHP to buy fertilizer for corn production. She only has a simple future plan for her family: that her children finish school through college and find decent and stable jobs someday.

loans.use: Fertilizer

They are from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. Lorly has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Lorly has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lorly is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Mrs. Elvie P. is 41 years old, married and blessed with two children. She is a bona fide resident of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Having her own small banana plantation, she's thankful to Paglaum Coop for giving her the opportunity to borrow 7,000 PHP that will be used for additional capital for her business. Her future plan is to continue having more customers and to send her children to school until college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional stock of bananas

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Hardworking and determined, Mrs. Jean S. is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old, married and has been blessed with four children who are studying in primary and secondary levels. Her husband is a farmer. Her corn production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a loan of 4,000 PHP to defray operating expenses for her corn-growing land. She needs to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers and labor costs. She hopes and prays that her business will expand and earn enough savings for her children’s education. She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that Kiva is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Payment for labor and to purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene O. is from Dipolog City. She is 36 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the repair of their residential house. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter for her three kids.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for house repair

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion T. is from the city of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old. Concepcion is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a seafood business. Her main source of income from the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught food in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 6 years.

In 2007, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional seafood to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Concepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Gene

texts.en: Mrs. Gene O. is 26 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She is a bonafide resident of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She's requesting her loan to use as additional capital for her banana selling business. She hopes to support her family through her little business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her banana selling business

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie B. is an individual member of Paglaum MPC. She lives in East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte.  She has 2 adult children. Currently they are operating a retail store and running a boarding house. They had an estimated net monthly revenue of 3,000 pesos from their business. She is requesting this loan to purchase additional items for her retail store, and part of the loan proceeds will be used to expand the boarding house.

She fervently hopes that both her business ventures will become successful, so that she and her children can set aside enough savings for retirement.

loans.use: For boarding house extension and to purchase additional items for sari-sari store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Mrs. Merlita B., 44 years old, is married and is a resident of Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City. She is married to a Barangay Councilor and they are blessed with two children. Their main source of income comes from their business named Eddie’s Barbecue located at Port Road Ozamiz City with main products of chicken and pork barbecue. They also offer other foods for breakfast, lunch and dinner in their eatery. They were able to send their children to college with the help of this business. As an active regular member of PAGLAUM MPC, she was able to avail multiple loans already. Now she is applying for an amount of P25,000.00 to add to her capital for purchasing raw chicken, pork and even fish and other ingredients to be used in their business. Her plan for business is to have a big restaurant someday. For her family, her plan is to give a better education to her children for their good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for barbecue business

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Mrs. Erenia L. is 40 years old and married with eight children but only five fully dependent. She lives with her husband, a hard working trackman named Ching Guan Jing Corp. Supported also by her daughter working in Manila, she receives P2,000.00 a month. Mrs. Erenia is a business-minded person. She has her own vegetable farm and she also buys and sells vegetables at the public market in Ozamiz City. She started her business in 1998. At this time, Paglaum MPC helps Mrs. L. Erenia with financial, savings and insurance services. 

Now she wants to have her own motor vehicle for their business with the help of KIVA financing through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase a motor vehicle for her business

loans.name: Fretzel Liza

texts.en:
Fretzel Liza B. is from Dapitan City. She is 38 years old. Fretzel Liza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fretzel Liza owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fretzel Liza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fretzel Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fretzel Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fretzel Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fretzel Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P. is from the city of San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 65 years old. Juana is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a rug making & potholder business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling general hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. Juana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana is requesting a new loan of 2500 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make rugs & potholders. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Juana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is a native of Cabgan, Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  She is married with eight children.  All of her children are adults. She is now on her 5th loan cycle amounting to 3,000 pesos.  The purpose of her loan is for the acquisition of a new fishing boat. She is always praying that they can harvest more fish so they can have more sales. This gives them more income so they can support the daily needs of the family and set aside enough savings for the future and for emergencies.

loans.use: To acquire a new fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn R. is a native of Cabgan, Punta Miray, Baliangao.  She is married with two children.  Her children are still at the school age stage.  She is 26 years old now.  Their main source of living is fishing and fish selling.  The couple has been in the business for eight years now.  Their monthly income from fishing is 4,000 pesos more or less.  Now she is availing a loan amounting to 7,000 for the making of a fishing boat.  She is hoping they can have a good catch so they can repay their loan on its installment due date.  She is hoping also that the family can save enough money for future use.  They aspire to be able to send their children to college and find their own living in the future too,

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a fishing boat

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy hails from D'BAN, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 49 years old and married with 3 children. All of her children are adults now. Presently they are operating a tailoring business. She is granted with a loan worth 25,000 pesos for the purchase of a sewing machine.

The family has been in the business for 10 years now. She earns at least 2,000 pesos per month. That's why they want to add an additional sewing machine unit so they can serve enough customers and that can add to their income as well. They aspire to have good business deals, augment their income and have good health always.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine unit

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a native from Cabgan, a small village situated across the island. Their place is an Island that separates from the mother barrio named Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. The member has to ride with a motorized pumpboat for at least 5 to 10 minutes to attend a weekly center meeting in Punta Miray.

Florence is married with 6 children. Most of the children are still school age. She has availed herself of her 10th loan cycle worth 10,000 pesos for the repairs of their existing house. Their main source of income is from fishing. Mrs. M., as shown in the picture, is seated in the middle with their house that has been in the process of repairs now. She hopes that they can always have a good catch so they can cope with their obligations with Paglaum.

loans.use: To purchase materials for house repairs

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 51 years old, married with 9 children who are at their adult-age already. The family has been in the fishing business for 20 years now. They had availed the 3rd loan cycle amounting to 3,500 pesos for the building of a fishing boat. The estimated monthly income is 5,500.

They were so thankful for Paglaum because of the opportunity they had made through their financing scheme. The couple is praying to have a good catch so they can save for the future, make a living and pay their obligation without delay.

loans.use: To purchase materials for building a fishing boat

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro - Group 6

texts.en:
Carmen E. is a young woman in her late twenties. She has four children ages 7, 6, 4 and 2. Carmen and the rest of the members of this group live in a section called Hoyo del Toro, a small settlement on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris. Despite being located by a highway exit, there are little signs of progress in this small community. Many of the small entrepreneurs who live in Hoyo del Toro have to go to San Pedro or other communities during the week to sell there.

Carmen decided to enter the clothing-sales business as a way to provide for her children. She doesn't have much education, but she is working on her abilities to be a good administrator. She wants to grow to become a clothing distributor and expand her sales to a larger area.

Please help us support Carmen and the rest of this group with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S. is 57 years old and resides with his five children and his wife in Phnom Penh. He is a mechanic and earns US $5 per day. His wife is a good housewife who stays at home. They are also supported by four children, two are garment factory workers and two are mechanics. Heng S. is asking for a loan to purchase tools and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn T. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion. She is 49 years old. Gwendolyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gwendolyn harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gwendolyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Gwendolyn joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gwendolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Gwendolyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Gwendolyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ricmar

texts.en:
Ricmar G. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Ricmar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ricmar sells fish to the local community. Ricmar has been engaged in his business for more than10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ricmar joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricmar is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing net. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ricmar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and to support his family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Victoria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios P. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married, and has six adult children. Remedios owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria L. is from the village of Lower Puntod. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Maria owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling bedding and bedding supplies to tourists and local community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne S. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married and has one infant child. Jeanne owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Jeanne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeanne joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jeanne is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to support her family's basic needs. loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra T. is from the village of Lower Puntod. She is 61 years old, married, and has four adult children.

Alejandra owns and operates a tailoring business, primarily providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,250 PHP a month.

In 2002, Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Vencita

texts.en: Vencita F. is from the village of Southern Looc. She is 59 years old, married, and has five adult children. Vencita owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Vencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Vencita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 as additional working capital for his rice-farming business. He is 38 years old and married to Wilma, who is also a Kiva borrower. They have two children: Harly Dave is 9 years old and in grade school and Hedel Wyze is 3 years old. They live happily in the village of St. Tomas Alicia, Isabela. 

Alexander hopes to improve his farming business in order to give his children a better life in the future and send them to school. With the help of the loan and with hard work and patience, Alexander knows he and his wife will be able to overcome the hardships of life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean A. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old, married, and has two school-age children. Mary Jean operates a family member's fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell such as "guso" or sea weeds. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy additional products to sell such as "guso" or sea weeds

loans.name: Arthuro

texts.en:
Arthuro is 41 years old and married to Virginia who is 37 years old. They help each other in maintaining their family’s standard of living, and they work hard to give their children a better future. Virginia manages a village store, and Arthur is a rice farmer. Sadly, Arthuro shared that his eldest child died because of a gunshot wound. He said it was the most tragic event that has ever happened to his family. Their youngest child, Gerald, is now nine years old and is studying in elementary school. Arthuro hopes to give him a good education so that he may have a successful future.

Arthuro is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 for his farming business. He hopes to expand his business with the help of the loan. His family lives in the village of St. Tomas in Alicia, Isabela where farming is the main source of income for most of the populace. Arthuro says that their village has an irrigated area, and they have enough water for all of their crops.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 53 years old and is married to Frenelinda. They were blessed with four children: Loren is 31 years old, Lea Amor is 25 years old and a college graduate, Rosalie is 21 years old, and their youngest, Merriam Mae is 17 years old and is a special child that requires a lot of attention. Cirilo and his wife hope that they will be able to give their youngest child a good and happy life despite her abnormalities.

Cirilo is hoping to borrow PHP 20,000 as additional capital for his rice farming activity. With the help of his wife, they are able to handle many of the things they need in life. However, they want to improve their livelihoods and have a sustainable business. So Cirilo decided to take out a loan as a means to achieve their family’s goals. Cirilo said, “We should be patient in order to have a productive lifestyle.”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
“Patience is next to hard work.” stated Donald T..
