Filing for divorce and the mother with a child, Ms. Salimata D. is 34 years old and currently lives at her parents' place in the Kouloukoro district of Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to continue in primary school because her parents lacked the means, she wasted no time going to work at her mother's side to earn an income. Salimata has been advancing on her own now for ten years. She chose as her niche the buying and selling of various goods, such as Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), jewelry, shoes, etc. This is a very profitable business for her because she is in high demand by the women of Koutiala City. Concerned about augmenting her working capital and satisfying her customer demands for quality, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2007. After two solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy 40 necklaces and 10 bolts of Wax pagnes. Supplies are procured in Bamako and often in Senegal. Sales are made in Koutiala City to customers composed of girls and married women, cash or credit accepted. Salimata hopes to realize a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to make loan interest payments, to care for her child, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Divine Elévation Plus Group

texts.fr: Fifi L. est propriétaire d’un restaurant au sud-est de Kinshasa. Elle a débuté cette activité en 1982 avec un capital de $5, grillant des poissons frais et les vendant devant leur parcelle. La période de 1982 en 1990, a été caractérisée par l’apprentissage, l’acquisition d’expérience du métier et la constitution d’une clientèle permanente. Les pillages de 1991 et 1993 ont sérieusement endommagé son affaire réduisant tous ses efforts fournis à néant. Depuis 2000 jusqu’à ce jour, Fifi a relancé son activité et est parvenue à la stabiliser par un travail déterminant et une bonne gestion. Son restaurant reçoit aujourd’hui une moyenne de 40 clients et lui génère un bénéfice de $10 par jour.  Actuellement, son capital propre est de $120. Vu le nombre croissant de ses clients qui demandent une grande quantité de poissons salés et des poulets, étant limitée en moyens financiers, Fifi a décidé d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Divine Elévation Plus » en vue de recevoir des crédits qui vont lui permettre de satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle et accroitre le revenu de l’affaire. C’est ainsi qu’avec le crédit reçu au mois de mai dernier, elle a pu s’acheter 1 carton de poissons salés et des poulets comme prévu pour son restaurant. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison de vente des vivres frais. Fifi a 41 ans, célibataire et mère d’un fils âgé de 21 ans.
texts.en:
Fifi L. is a restaurant owner in southeast Kinshasa. In 1982 with $5 in capital, she started this business, grilling and sell fresh fish in front of her parcel of land. The period from 1982 to 1990 was characterized by apprenticing, acquiring experience in the trade, and building a permanent customer base. The pillaging from 1991 to 1993 seriously damaged her business, destroying all her efforts. In 2000, Fifi started up again and managed to achieve stability through determined work and good managing. Today, her restaurant receives an average of 40 customers a day generating a profit of $10 daily. Currently her capital amounts to $120. Given the growing number of customers who are demanding a lot of salted fish and chicken, and given her limited financial means, Fifi decided to join a HOPE RDC group named “Divine Elévation Plus” with the aim of receiving loans that will enable her to satisfy customer needs and to grow her business revenues. Thus, with the loan received last May, she was able to buy a box of salted fish and some chickens, as planned, for her restaurant. Her ambition is to open a store selling fresh staple foods. Fifi is 41 years old, unmarried, and the mother of a 21-year-old son.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of salted fish and some chickens for her restaurant

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, who is a 39-year-old married man with two children living in Dawhet Aramoun in Aley, has owned his own soft drinks and cocktails shop since 2004. Today, Hassan is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase merchandise and a new juice machine.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a new juice machine.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih, a 39-year-old married man living with his wife in Al Hadath in Mount Lebanon, has been working as a DJ and party organizer since 1994.  With 14 years of experience in the field, Nazih is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a musical instrument.

loans.use: To purchase a musical instrument.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef, a 22-year-old-man living in Al Laylaki, Mount Lebanon, has been producing furniture for the past 10 years. Today, Youssef is requesting to borrow $700 in order to buy equipment for his project.

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina Bahić, who lives in a suburb of Gradačac, is 27, married and the mother of one girl. Her husband is employed as a seasonal worker in construction outside of BiH while Jasmina is a housewife who keeps busy working in the field and her garden. She grows vegetable for her own use and produces strawberries, paprika and tomatoes for sale to earn extra income for the household.

She has already repaid three loans from WWI and is now requesting a fourth one in the amount of 1000 KM to buy supplies for growing fruits and vegetables. She hopes to develop this business and provide a higher living standard for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan R. is 53 years old and is married to Mrs. Rufina Ferreira, with whom he has three older daughters. Mr. Juan produces cheese and also sells milk. He has been working in this business since 2000, thanks to help from his brother, who worked in an upholstery shop. It was due to this income that they bought a cow with a calf to start the business.

Currently he is also working to make leather footwear, which provides a large amount of income. Thanks to his work, his daughters were able to continue their education, and now they live on their own.

The credit applied for is for the purchase of cow fodder, so that the cattle can be well fed and produce quality milk.

loans.use: To purchase cow fodder

loans.name: Bernardino Domingo

texts.en: Mr. Bernardino is married and has two children.  The family works very successfully selling fruits, vegetables and basic necessities.  The credit he has thus far been given has allowed him to expand the business to open a diner.  Mr. Bernadino is very thankful to the Foundation for its support, capital and trust.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. Ana P. is 48 years old and is married to Isidoro Marecos, who is a construction worker who earns a good living. They have a younger son and all live in the city of Pilar, in the neighborhood of Convai Norte. They live in their own house, where they have all the comforts of home.

Ana has been working in her tailoring business for more than ten years, and has all of the necessary resources for the development of her business – a large salon where she can make her garments.

She applied for credit to be able to buy fabric for her tailor shop, more specifially to make school uniforms. She is very thankful for the support she receives from the Paraguay Foundation. She plans to take advantage of the opportunity to grow her business, as this is the third loan she has received from the Foundation.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her tailor shop

loans.name: Enrriqueta

texts.en:
Mrs. Enrriqueta A. is 61 years old and married to Mr. Natividad Velazco, with whom she has a younger son. She is a teacher and lives in the city of Pilar, in the San Vicente neighborhood. They own their own home, which has all of the necessities of a home, such as electricity.
 
She operates a general store that has been open for eight years and has all of the necessities to develop her business.

She is applying for credit to buy agricultural products in general, as well as cheese, which is her principal source of income. She is very thankful for the support she receives from the Paraguay Foundation, and is very excited to take advantage of the opportunity to make her business grow. This is her second loan with the institution.

loans.use: To purchase of materials for her store

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Mr. Teodoro T. is 48 years old and married to Cristina Soto, who has been employed as a domestic worker for more than ten years. They have older children, and live in Pilar, in the Ytororo district. They own their own house where they have all the daily necessities.

Teodoro is a businessman, and has been doing his activity for more than seven years. He owns all the basic necessities to develop his business. For work, he travels throughout the county distributing cheese and agricultural products. The credit applied for is to purchase cheese for sale.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.en:
Mr. Juan A. is 54 years old and is a baker, a profession which he learned more than fifteen years ago. His family consists of his wife, Alba Jorjelina Irala de A., 37 years old, and two sons: 14 and 20. Each member of the family takes part in the small business. 

Juan started with only a small amount of capital. Thanks to his efforts, he currently has all of the elements for his day to day work. He makes many different types of bread, as well as cookies and pastries among other things.

Juan applied for a loan with the Foundation to buy a dough-rolling machine, as his current one is completely obsolete. The new machine will help him improve the quality of his products so that he will then to be able to satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a dough-rolling machine

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 59 years old, married to a construction worker, and has two older children.

Erma, as she is called by her clients and friends, has a diner and a small grocery store. She provides breakfast, lunch and snacks to paper factory workers located close to her house.

She owned a grocery store and a butcher shop, but it was robbed three times and she was forced to close her business. After one year with out any business, the factory opened and Erma started selling fast food and later full meals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel S. D. G. is 52 years old and married to Eladio Jimenez, who is 58 years old. He works in the municipality. They have two older children, one of which works in Itaipu and the other son is working in Spain.

Three years ago she began selling silver jewelry after a friend told her about the business. With much effort, she was able to form a clientele, and then applied for a loan with the Foundation to acquire more jewelry so she can fill her day to day orders.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: El Joven Pablo Roberto V. F. tiene 34 años de edad. Esta casado y tiene 6 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este humilde negocio por que tenia que ser un padre responsable ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos y a su esposa, y comenzó ofreciendo los servicios de transporte por medio de un triciclo y día a día de la poca ganancia que recibía guardaba una parte, hasta que decide establecer su pulpería con tanto esfuerzo, el mayor recuerdo que tiene de su antiguo trabajo es que recorría un sin numero de lugares muy contento. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias de vida para que sus hijos no le falte nada en la vida.
texts.en:
Pablo Roberto V. F. is 34 years old. He is married with 6 children. He runs a neighborhood grocery store, which he started 7 years ago because he needed to be a responsible father and support his wife and children. He obtained the funds to start the business by saving what little profit he got from offering his services riding a tricycle taxi. His best memory from his old job is happily riding around to an infinite number of places. His greatest dream is to give his family what they need so that his children will never find themselves wanting for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is a 65-year-old woman born with the zodiac sign of Capricorn.  She is married to Fernando A., a tricycle driver and they are blessed with two children, a son and a daughter. Her daughter Marivic is a 23-year-old nursing student. Her son Fernando Jr. is presently working abroad.  Her family resides at Morong, Rizal, Philippines. 

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) a Kiva partner in the Philippines in 2003.  During her membership, she showed excellent performance as to her attendance in meetings, repayment and projects.  Now, on her 10th loan, she proposes the amount of 35,000 pesos as additional capital in her primary business hog raising. She has been engaged in this business for six years. Now the money that she loan will be used to pay four piglets for raising and the remaining amount will be used to finance her secondary business, hog slaughtering.

Now her dream is to help her daughter finish college and find a job. She also dreams to have her own car for personal and business use and also to help her grandchildren with their school needs.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the photo. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: Buyay four piglets and fund hog slaughtering.

loans.name: Ngorogoro Group

texts.en:
J. M., age 30, is married with two children, ages six and three and a half months. He has a furniture mart business which he started three years ago. He works daily from 7am until 7pm and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $746.

This will be J.’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his business by buying more wood for his furniture business. He has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to increase his capital to buy more materials, like leather for sofa sets and vanish for wood.

J. will share this loan with his group, "Ngorongoro" which totals 18 members. Members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, J. is second from right, in blue.

loans.use: Buy leather, cloth for sofas, vanish for wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing new sewing machine.

loans.name: 7 Monday Group

texts.en:
This credit goes to the purchase of merchandise and basic needs. All the women have a credit from between 300,000 to 500,000 Gs.

1 Liz Fabiana M. . Used clothes sale 2 Benjamina O.. Sale of Cleaning products 3 Pablina G.. Food sales 4 Primitiva A.. Small grocery store 5 María L. . Clothing sales 6 Zulma G.. Avon product sales 7 Deolinda C.. Clothing sales 8 Josefina O.. Small grocery store 9 Presentación R.. Lingerie sales 10 Lourdes O.. Hair salon 11 Celia C. Food sales 12 Tomasa G.. Small grocery store 13 Selva E.. Coal sales 14 Lucy R.. Clothing sales 15 Basilia S.. Sports clothing sales 16 Maria A.. Food sales

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel is single and lives with his retired mother, who is under his care. Daniel started his position thanks to his father, who taught him the profession and who is very well known throughout the area for the good work he does.

Currently Daniel works in a friend’s workshop, who lent it to him for three years. This lease is very expensive and he needs a new workshop. Daniel was saving little by little to construct his own work space.

He has demonstrated that he is a good and responsible person with his committments. The credit applied for is to finish a phase of construction of a new workshop.

loans.use: Construction of his own repair shop

loans.name: Agar Marlene

texts.en:
Mrs. Agar is single and lives with her parents. She does not have any children. She is a hairdresser and has a complete hair salon. Additionally she has a small stock of hair products for sale.

She studied to be a hairdresser, and her parents helped her gather capital in order to start her business.

The hair salon has a solid base of clientele thanks to the good attention it has received. Additonally she has a consistent location, as it has been in the same place for 5 years.

The credit applied for goes to the purchase of clothing, as her hair salon is very busy and she has faith that it could be a very profitable salesplace.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Magda V. tiene 45 años de edad, reside en la colonia Centroamérica en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo trabaja como diseñador grafico y por cuenta propia, tiene dos hijos, uno trabajo y el otro estudia. Tiene su propio negocio de ventas de cosmético y perfume. Antes trabaja en una empresa del gobierno en donde inicio a vender sus productos con fondos propios y  al ver que se le ganaba decidió colocarlo en su casa, desde hace un año esta ubicado lo cual le ha permitido ingresar nuevos productos. Se le ha presentado dificultades de incrementar las cantidades de los pedidos y de la compra de producto por falta de financiamiento. Esta agradecida con Afodenic por la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio con el préstamo que esta solicitando,   comprara: ropas para damas, caballero y niños, ropa interior, perfumes, cosméticos y prendas. Lo cual le generara mayores utilidades, desarrollándose como pequeño negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Magda V. is 45 years of age, married and lives in the Centroamérica District of the capital of Managua. Her husband works freelance as a graphic designer. She has two children, one working and the other studying. She has her own business selling cosmetics and perfume. Señora Magda used to work in a state-owned company where she used her own money to get started selling her products. Once she saw what she was earning she decided to locate it in her house. That was a year ago and it has allowed her to introduce new products. It's been difficult to increase her volume of orders and to buy products because she doesn't have financing. She is very grateful to AFODENIC for the opportunity to build up her business. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy: clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children; underwear, perfumes, cosmetics and garments. These will bring her greater profits as her small business grows in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing and perfume.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Doralicía Benítez formed this committee. She lives in the Fátima district of Ciudad del Este, is the mother of two children, and works selling hens. She contacted her neighbors and friends in order to form this committee in their area.

The committee is named the 8th of December, and is made up of 18 very active and supportive women, all from the same area. They have many different activities, such as selling: pants, t-shirts, tomatoes, onions, garlic, facial cream, apples, bananas, sodas, cookies, sweets, melons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, dustpans, detergent, fabric softener, meats, etc. Some women are starting their own businesses. All of the women asked for credit between 300,000 and 1,000,000 Paraguayan guaranis. The credit will go toward the purchase of merchandise and raw materials for sale.

1 Maria Felicia B. Small grocery store 2 Rafaela B. Dressmaker 3 Doralicia B. Hen sales 4 Rosalina M. Sales of foodstuffs 5 Bartola D. Ice cream sales 6 Guillermina G. Cosmetic sales 7 Ramona B. Ice cream sales 8 Lilian F. Vegetable sales 9 Gabina D. Sugar sales 10 Rocio I. Clothing sales 11 Nimia E. Clothing sales 12 Amancia V. Hamburger sales 13 Librada A. Sale of Cleaning products 14 Sara R. Candy sales 15 Aurelia G. Food sales 16 María N. Small grocery store 17 Nilsa A. Hen sales 18 Emilce A. Vegetable sales

loans.use: To buy hens for sale

loans.name: Elvio

texts.en:
Mr. Elvio is married to Mrs. Angela. They have three children, two that are older and live with their spouses; the other is school aged, and helps out around the house. Mr. Elvio works as a traveling salesperson – he sells jewelry, blankets and home electric products in the neighborhoods of Ciudad del Este. Additionally, he has been able to obtain a motorcart in order to commercialize the sale of mandioca, a traditional paraguayan food, in the Abasto market. He is a very active man, and counts on his wife and son to be able to have both businesses.

Mr. Elvio was given credit by the Paraguayan Foundation and has paid punctually on five occasions. He is an optimist through whatever challenges that present themselves. The credit applied for gives him the oppportunity to increase his clientele.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en: Mrs Florinda is married to an exemplary husband, Reinaldo, and they have two children. They both work to support the family. They have their own house and a small business – a laundrymat. Mrs Florinda's husband has always supported her business. Mrs Florinda is applying for credit so that her business is able to meet the demand of customers and neighbors who want their clothes cleaned. She has the only laundrymat in the neighborhood and she needs a new machine in order to keep up with demand. If she receives this credit Mrs Florinda will be able to renovate her machinery, allowing her to provide her services faster and earn a higher income. She is a very friendly, enterprising person who wants to progress, all of which are very important qualities for furthering her business.

loans.use: To buy an automatic washer

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es: María Angelina, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, ella tiene 28 años de edad, su esposo no esta en Guatemala, 2 de sus hijas están estudiando y las otras 2 son pequeñas. Ella se dedica a vender cómales para hacer  las tortillas, ella  vende en el mercado de su localidad, en su casa también tiene venta de cómales, estos los fabrican en el municipio de San Raymundo y se los llevan a ella ya listos para venderlos.  Su negocio lo inicio hace 12 años, su préstamo lo necesita para invertir mas por la época de invierno, ya que  necesita estar preparada para atender la demanda  por la temporada,  ya que en esta época por las lluvias no se fabrican muchos.  Sus sueños son que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Angelina is married and has 4 children. She is 28-years-old. Her husband doesn't live in Guatemala. Two of her daughters are studying, and the other two are still small. She sells comales (dishes used for making tortillas) at the market in her community. She also sells comales in her home. They are made in San Raymundo and they are brought to her ready to sell. She started her business 12 years ago. She needs this loan to invest in more merchandise for the rainy season since she needs to be prepared to handle the season's demand. Because of the rain, not many comales are made during this time. Her dreams are to expand her business and to have her daughters finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of comales to sell, to make the most of the rainy season.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela G., es viuda desde hace 15 años tiene 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, ella tiene 46 años de edad, y se dedica a vender verduras en el mercado municipal, ella  vende tomates, cebollas, papas, y una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender.  Ella necesita su crédito para ampliar su negocio, el cual estaría a cargo de su hija.  Adela desea tener una mejor condición económica y de vida, para ella y sus hijos.  Ella también se dedican a crianza de pollos y marranos en sus tiempos libres ya que la verdura la vende los días de mercado que son los días domingo, martes y jueves, sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y se prosperen en la vida.
texts.en:
Adela G. has been a widow for 15 years and has 4 children, who are all adults. She is 46-years-old and sells vegetables in the city market. She sells tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. One of her daughters helps her sell. She needs this credit to expand her business, which her daughter would be in charge of. Adela hopes to improve the economic situation of both herself and her children. She also raises chickens and pigs in her free time since she sells vegetables all day on Sundays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Her dreams are to have her children continue with their education and that they prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business of selling vegetables at market

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina G., tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo mayor de edad, y los otros dos le apoyan en su negocio de la crianza de pollos.  Este negocio ella lo tiene desde hace 30 años.  Ella vive en San Martín Jilotepeque y tiene un terreno como a 5 kilómetros de su casa, donde  tiene su negocio de crianza y engorde de pollos, ella los vende en el pueblo y también la buscan en su casa para comprarle, ella  tiene pollos de varios tamaños para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesiten.  Ella necesita su préstamo para comprar más pollos y también  comida y  además quiere tener pavos y patos.  Sus sueños son tener otra granja más y poder vender también pollos por libra ya que ahorita solo vende enteros.
texts.en:
Sabina G. is 53 and is a single mother of one adult son and two others who help her with her business of raising chickens. She has had this business for 30 years. She lives in San Martín Jilotepeque and has some land 5 kilometers away from her house, which is where she has her business of raising and fattening chickens. She sells them in town and people always come to her house to buy from her. She has chickens of various sizes so her customers can always find what they need. She needs her loan to buy more chickens and their food. She also would like to have turkeys and ducks. Her dreams are to have another, larger farm and to be able to sell chickens by the pound since right now she sells them whole.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and food for them and to expand her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 4` Group

texts.en: Paul is the head of his household and provides for his wife and three children. He owns a small clothing retail business called 'Ropas Paul', and his customers are primarily people from the local community. With his loan Paul will buy clothes in bulk. This will reduce his transport costs to the nearby city. In the future he hopes to expand his business and generate enough income to have his own house. Please help Paul and his group expand their businesses. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Cecilia P. formed this group in the Fátima neighborhood of the Ciudad del Este by contacting her neighbors and friends. She is the mother of seven children, and works selling food with her husband. 

The group is called 'Miraculous Medal' and is maD. up of 16 active and supportive women, all from the same area.  They all all engaged in different activities, such as clothing sales (selling pants, shirts); small grocery stores (selling brooms, dustpans, detergents, fabric softeners, meats, bananas, sodas, cookies, sugar, milk, oil, candies, melons, tomatoes, apples, onions, garlic); the sale of cosmetics (such as facial creams). Others are starting their own new businesses with a fixed income.  

The women applied each for a credit between 300,000 and 800,000 PYG which will be used for the purchase of merchandise for resale.  

1  Petrona G. D. S. – dressmaker 
2  Modesta P. – dressmaker 
3  Cynthia S.  – clothing sales
4  Maria Estela A. – small grocery store
5  Julia L. – clothing sales 
6  Cecilia P.  – clothing sales
7  Mirian T.  – lingerie sales 
8  Tomasa C. – used clothing sales 
9  Lelia A. – cosmetics sales 
10  Lucrecia M. – ice-cream sales
11  Dominga S.	 – clothing sales
12  Laura S.  – clothing sales
13  Maria G.	 – plastic sales
14  Nancy P. – clothing sales
15  Alicia P. – hair salon 
16  Blanca R. – clothing sales

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité, fue la señora Deolinda A..  Sra. A. esta casada con el Señor Bernardo M. y es madre de cuatro hijos.  Se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y vive en el la Ciudad de Presidenta Franco. A la señora le agrado el Programa de Comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres En Progreso ”, esta constituido  por 19 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas del barrio.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta de ropas, venta de frutas y verduras, y otros.  Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 c/u.  El crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para vender.

Las integrantes son:  

Merarda Gladys G.	-  Elaboracion de Productos de Limpieza
Sonia G.	-  Venta de Ropa
Liz Fabiola G. - 	Venta de joyas de Plata
Olag Chamorro	 - Despensa
Deolinda A.	-  Venta De Cosmeticos
Petrona R.	- Venta de Ropa
Graciela S.- 	Peluqueria
Andrea M.	-  Venta De Ropa
Dionisia I.	-  Venta de Empanadas
Edith B.	- Venta De Ropa Interior
Mirna D.	-  Venta de Bijouteries
Angelica E. -	Venta de Quiniela
Aurora V. - 	Venta De Ropa
Elva D. - 	Costura
Dolly D. - 	Venta De Ropa
Norma R. - 	Venta de Ropa
Cipriana L. - 	Venta de Huevo y Queso
Rosa C. - 	Venta de Cosmeticos
Celsa G. - 	Venta de Comidas
texts.en:
For the formation of the committee, it was Señora Deolinda A.. Mrs. A. is married to Señor Bernardo M., and is the mother of four children. She works selling cosmetics and she lives in the City of Presidenta Franco. She likes the Program of the Committee, and the Mujeres Emprendedoras (“Hardworking Women”) of the Funcacion Paraguaya. She talked with her neighbors and friends in order to form the committee in her neighborhood. The committee called “Mujeres En Progreso,” (“Progressing Women”) is made up of 19 active and organized women from the whole neighborhood. They have different activities, like selling clothes, selling fruit and vegetables, and others. The women are taking out a loan of Gs 300.000 each. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise to sell. The members are: Merarda Gladys G. – Making cleaning products Sonia G. – Clothing sales Liz Fabiola G. – Selling silver jewelry Olag Chamorro – Food pantry Deolinda A. – Cosmetics sales Petrona R. – Clothing sales Graciela S.- Hairdresser Andrea M. – Clothing sales Dionisia I. – Empanadas sales Edith B. – Underwear sales Mirna D. – Costume jewelry sales Angelica E. – Lottery sales Aurora V. – Clothing sales Elva D. - Seamstress Dolly D. – Clothing sales Norma R. – Clothing sales Cipriana L. – Eggs and cheese sales Rosa C. – Cosmetics sales Celsa G. – Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Josefa Herlinda

texts.es:
Doña Josefa Herlinda C. T.  cuenta con 49  años de edad, es casada se dedica a la Artesanía en Confección de Playeras  cuenta con un pequeño taller  junto a su esposo conjuntamente con sus 4 hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica, lleva 8 años de elaborar y se encuentra en el Paraje Chicha clan municipio y  departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar dos máquinas industriales y así poder facilitar mejor su trabajo y poder cubrir la demanda de sus
Clientes como también poder generar más empleos en su comunidad. Y mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Josefa Herlinda C. T. is 49 years old, married and makes a living as an artisan making sneakers. She has a small shop along with her husband, with whom she has had four children. She has been dedicated to her craft for eight years in the Paraje Chicha commune in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala. Currently, her customers' demands have grown, but her current economic condition is not sufficient to meet them, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to help her increase her capital. She is requesting a loan with the goal of purchasing two industrial sewing machines to better facilitate her work so she can meet her customers' demands and also generate more jobs in her community. This will increase her earnings and give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 3 Group

texts.en: Fhlippe is a single parent, the head of his household that provides for his three children. He is a clothes street vendor, his business is titled “Ropas Felipe”. With the loan granted he will buy clothes in bulk to reduce transportation costs. In the future he hopes to own his own vehicle so he can easily get from one place to the next. His lifetime goal is to see his children prosper. Please help Fhlippe and his group expand their businesses. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of new clothes in bulk to increase his profit margins

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa O. T.  cuenta con 45 años de edad es casada, vive con sus 4 hijos, Actualmente se dedica a la Elaboración de Cortes Típicos lleva 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad,  reside en el caserío Xapatan Aldea Chipuac municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive no son suficientes por lo que solicito un préstamo y acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo ya que la demanda de sus clientes y  la de su trabajo a crecido por lo que necesita comprar materia prima para poder cubrir la demanda y así generar más fuentes de trabajo mejorando sus ingresos y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa O. T. is 45 years old, married and lives with her four children. She is an artisan who has been making a living making typical garments for the past five years. She resides in the village of Xapatan Aldea Chipuac, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, but her living conditions are not sufficient, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She is requesting a loan because her customers' demands for her products and her work has grown and she needs to purchase raw materials in order to meet their demands. This will generate more sources of work and improve her income and help her provide a better education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Amelio

texts.en:
Mr. Amelio is married to Mrs. Marcian. They have four children who all have their own income and live outside of the home.

He works in a bakery, and with the help of Kiva, saved enough money to be able to open a small grocery store next to his bakery. He is very thankful that he has alternative sources of income and more possibilities to increase his income. He says that investing is the only way to confront crisis. He also owns a taxi that brings in a small amount of family income. 

Mr. Amelio, at 66 years old, still has an enterprising spirit and motivation to continue to progress, which is very important in achieving goals.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, herbs among other things for his shop

loans.name: Ricardo Adán

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo Adán C. D. L.  cuenta con 33 años D. edad, soltero, es “Graduado D. la carrera D. Bachiller en Ciencias y Letras” Actualmente está trabajando como trabajador Social, en diferentes Municipios D. la Ciudad D. Guatemala, el resiD. en el paraje Alvarado, del Cantón Juchanep, municipio y departamento  D. Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que viaja son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder transportarse D. un lugar a otro facilitando su trabajo y poder cubrir el área que le corresponD. en mejor tiempo posible como también así poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
The youth Ricardo Adán C. D. L. is 33 years old and is a bachelor. He is a “Graduate of the course of Bachelors in Science and Letters”. Currently, he is working as a social worker in different suburbs of Guatemala City. He lives in the place called Alvarado, Cantón Juchanep, city and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, but the conditions in which he travels are very complicated, and so he is asking for a loan from ASDIR to be able to move himself from one place to another, facilitating his work and enabling him to cover his area in the best time possible and also to make a better income and give a better life to his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma R. is married and has three young children. Norma studied tailoring when she lived with her parents, who took care of the costs of her studies, as she was their only daughter.

With a little bit of savings she had from a previous job, and with the help of her husband, Mrs. Norma bought her first sewing machine and started her own small business. Due to the quality of her garments and good attention to detail, she now has a well-established clientele, for whom she makes school and work uniforms.

Mrs. Norma was part of a committee of women, with whom she paid off her debts and demonstrated herself to be hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make uniforms for a local business

loans.name: La Familia Renacer Grupos 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Aida has been making curtains in her home for the past fifteen years. She has a small shop in the front of her house which is located on a bustling corner of Santiago. Her business has served as supplementary income and has helped put her three children through school.

She is seeking now to expand her business by offering various housewares and women's fashion accessories (such as shoes, handbags, etc.), in addition to her custom curtains. The loan will serve as capital for her to expand her product line. The income from Aida's business goes to help support her family.

loans.use: To add housewares and women's fashion accessories to her inventory

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Santos Manuel T. V. cuenta con 26  años de edad, casado,  Actualmente está trabajando como trabajador prestando sus servicios en la tejeduría elaborando manteles Típicos reside en el caserío Xapatan Aldea Chipuac municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive no son suficientes por lo que solicito un préstamo y acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitarlo  y así poder comprar una pequeña maquina industrial para la fabricación de Algodón el cual es otro fuentes más de sus ingresos  para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y a la de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Santos Manuel T. V. is 26 years old and is married. Currently he is working as a worker, providing his services in a weaver’s shop making traditional blankets. He lives in the rural town Xapatan Aldea Chipuac, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, but the conditions in which he lives are not adequate, and because of this he asked for a loan from ASDIR. He is asking for one so that he can buy a small industrial machine in order to make cotton as another source of income for him, in order to improve his condition of life and that of his family

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine to make cotton

loans.name: Francisco Fernándo

texts.es: El Joven Francisco Fernándo S. M.  cuenta con 22  años de edad, soltero, es “Graduado de la carrera de Enfermería” Actualmente está trabajando como trabajador Social, en diferentes Municipios de la Ciudad de Guatemala, el reside en la Aldea Palomora de Sana Andrés Xecul del municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que viaja son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder transportarse de un lugar a otro facilitando su trabajo y poder cubrir el área que le corresponde en mejor tiempo posible como también así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The youth Francisco Fernándo S. M. is 22 years old and is single. He is a “Graduate of the course of Nursing”. Currently he is working as a social worker in different suburbs of Guatemala City. He lives in the small town Palomora de Sana Andrés Xecul in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The conditions in which he travels are very complicated and so he is asking for a loan from ASDIR to enable him to transport himself from one place to another, facilitating his work so he can cover the area he is assigned to in the best time possible and so also be able to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marcelino Feliciano

texts.es: El Joven Ricardo Adán C. D. L.  cuenta con 23 años D. edad, soltero, es “Graduado D. la carrera D. Bachiller Industrial ” Actualmente está Prestando sus servicios como Lector D. Contadores en el municipio D. la Ciudad D. Guatemala, el resiD. en el paraje Alvarado, del Cantón Juchanep, municipio y departamento  D. Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que viaja son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder transportarse D. un lugar a otro facilitando su trabajo y poder cubrir el área que le corresponD. en mejor tiempo posible como también así poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
The youth Ricardo Adán C. D. L. is 23 years old and is single. He is a “Graduate of the course of Bachelor Industrial”. Currently he is loaning his services as a Lecturer of Accounting in Guatemala City. He lives in the place called Alvarado, in Cantón Juchanep, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala,. The conditions in which he travels are very complicated, and so he is asking for a loan from ASDIR to enable him to transport himself from one place to another, facilitating his job so he could cover his area in the best time possible and so also be able to increase his income and give a better life to his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Santos Zenaida

texts.es: La Señora Santos Zenaida X. T. cuenta con 24 años de edad, Casada con un hijo “Graduada de la carrera de Maestra de Enseñanza” Actualmente está Prestando servicios en la comunidad de Nimasac Municipios y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive  son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder comprar una estufa para poder cocinar sus alimentos  ya que son ingresos son muy bajos y adquiriendo esta necesidad facitará la preparación de sus alimentos y así poder aprovechar el tiempo para seguir trabajando en su segunda jornada laborar, como también ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Zenaida X. is 24 years old and is married. She has a son. She is a graduate of the course of Teacher of Education. Currently she is using her services in the community of Nimasac, in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The conditions in which she lives are very difficult, and so she is asking for a loan from ASDIR. This would enable her to buy a stove to be able to cook her food because their income is very low. Acquiring this necessity would enable the preparation of their food and so she would be able to make the most of the time in order to continue working in her second job, and also to help increase their income and to give a better life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposa la Sra. Paulina Soto con la cual tiene un hijo menor de 4 años.
Se dedica a la actividad del transporte urbano de pasajeros Santa Cruz- Abasto.
El destino del préstamo es para realizar una reparación a su vagoneta y dejarla en buenas condiciones, para prestar  servicio de transporte.
Se encuentra trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2008. 
“Gracias a Emprender puedo continuar con mi objetivo de comprarme una nueva vagoneta” dijo.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in his parents’ home with his wife, Señora Paulina Soto, with whom he has a small 4 year old son. He works in urban passenger transportation from Santa Cruz to Abasto. This loan would be used to make a repair to his car and to put it in good condition, in order to provide his transportation service. He began working with our institution in the year 2008. “Thanks to EMPRENDER I can continue with my goal of buying a new wagon,” he says.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his taxi

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza Group 4

texts.en:
Evelin S. R. is the group leader of the Mujeres con Esperanza Group 4. She has been selling handbags and women's shoes on the street for the past year. She began her business with a loan from Esperanza. She is receiving her second loan now to expand her business.

Sometimes Evelin has a hard time selling her wares, she quotes, "Sometimes there is not enough money on the street." When selling is slow, it is hard to accumulate enough capital to restock her inventory. The loan will go to invest in more stock for her to sell.

Evelin and her husband live on their own and have two daughters. Evelin's husband sells oranges in a market stall to support their growing family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en: Pascacio (pictured above, on a bike) has a joyful personality. He is a young father of two who strives for success. He lives in Consuelo, an agricultural community of sugar cane farmers. In this particular community, the sugar cane plantation owners pay their daily workers in tickets. Those tickets can be later cashed in at the end of the month. Pascacio, learning from microfinance, plans to finance some of those tickets for people who cannot wait until the end of the month, and charge interest. With the profits, he hopes to one day open his own store and have his own truck.

loans.use: To finance sugar cane tickets

loans.name: Melva

texts.es: LA SEÑORA VENDE PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS A CREDITO Y ATIENDE UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE DULCES Y HAMBURGUESAS EN EL COLEGIO MARIA MIKAELA DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SU SUEGRA. ES UNA PERSONA MUY SACRIFICADA YA QUE ADEMÁS HACE LIMPIEZA EN EL COLEGIO EN EL TURNO DE LA TARDE. EN ESTE MOMENTO ES ELLA QUIEN MANTIENE AL HOGAR YA QUE EL ESPOSO ESTÁ SIN TRABAJO, ÉSTE LE ESTA AYUDANDO EN LAS TAREAS DE LIMPIEZA DEL COLEGIO HASTA QUE ENCUENTRE UN EMPLEO.
texts.en:
This lady sells food products on credit and attends a stall where sweets and hamburgers are sold in the high school Maria Mikaela. She has done this for the past 5 years. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house. She is a very sacrificing person and she also cleans the school in the afternoons. Currently, it is she who maintains the home since her husband is without work, because of this she is helping with the cleaning work at the school until her husband finds a job.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, soda pop, rice, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en: Beatriz is a mother of four who is kind-hearted and loves to help her community whenever possible. With this loan she will purchase fruits and vegetables that are commonly eaten daily in her community, such as bananas, apples, yams, and potatoes, and she will resell them in smaller quantities primarily in Consuelo, her hometown. She hopes that one day she will have her own grocery store. Please help Beatriz and her group make their dreams a reality. Thank you.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento tiene una antiguedad D. D. 6 ciclos (mas o menos 3 años D. vida), esta conformado por señoras D. un mismo bario "La Chimba". La señora Maribel , es la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento "MIKAELA" D. la Agencia "PANAMERICANA", ella trabaja vendiendo artefactos a credito  en su barrio. La señora Susana S. C.. es la socia mas antigua en el grupo ella esta  como Tesorera del Banco, ella es muy trabajadora en su  negocio, ella venD. cosmeticos D. toda marca y camina bastante ofreciendo y cobrando. La señora Barbara tambien es una socia antigua del grupo y ella esta ocupando el cargo D. secretaria del Banco, su actividad es D. vender comida en el centro D. la ciudad tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es chofer.
texts.en:
The Bank of Beginnings has an old group of 6 loan cycles (more or less 3 years of existence). It is maD. up of women from a single neighbourhood, “La Chimba” (“The Pigtail”). Señora Maribel is the president of the Bank of Beginnings “MIKAELA”, from the Agency “PANAMERICANA”. She works selling items on credit in her neighbourhood. Señora Susana S. C. is the eldest member of the group. She is the treasurer of the Bank. She is very hard-working in her business. She sells cosmetics of all brands and she walks a fair distance offering and earning. Señora Barbara is also an elderly member of the group, and she serves in the position of secretary of the Bank. Her work is selling food in the city center. She has three children and her husband is a driver.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1 Group

texts.en: Casimira is a high school graduate and mother of six who makes her living by selling new clothes from her home. She will use this loan to expand her inventory with a greater variety and to purchase clothing in bulk so people in her community can have a greater selection when they come to purchase new attire. She hopes to have her own store one day. Please help Casimira and her group expand their business. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria O. Q. tiene un puesto de venta de refresco de linaza y empanadas desde hace once años en la zona San Carlos del Mercado La Cancha, necesita comprarse una maquina para moler la linaza ya que actualmente muele la linaza con una herramienta manual y esto le esta afectando a su salud. Es separada, sus hijos ya son mayores pero les ayuda con los nietos. Vive en casa de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Victoria O. Q. has an empañadas and linseed soft drink stall. She has had this stall for 11 years in the neighbourhood San Carlos del Mercado La Cancha. She needs to buy a machine to crush the linseed, as she currently mashes the linseed with a manual tool and this is affecting her health. She is separated. Her children are already grown up, but she helps them with her nieces and nephews. She lives in her son’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine to process linseed

loans.name: Test

texts.en: T.

loans.use: Test

loans.name: Lucia Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia tiene la actividad de venta de desayunos en uno de los mercados mas populares de nuestra ciudad como es el mercado Yungas ubicado en la Zona centrica de Miraflores desde hacer 10 años, su jornada empieza a las 6:00 de la mañana ya que ella vive en la ciudad de El Alto y tiene que desplazarse todos los dias con sus hijos hasta  la ciudad de La Paz que es un viaje de 50 Minutos.   Atiende con desayunos a todos lo que trabajan desde tempranas horas de la mañana  como ser albañiles, personas que trabajan en fabricas, en la alcadia con la liempieza de la ciudad y otras. Es una persona muy trabajadora y muy buena madre de familia, tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar uno de ellos tiene un defecto en la vista que lo esta haciendo tratar con un especialista, pero lamentablemente no cuenta con seguro medico que cubra estos gastos.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia has work selling breakfasts in one of the more popular markets in our city. This is the Yungas market, and it has been located in the central suburb Miraflores for the past 10 years. Her working day begins at 6AM, as she lives in the city El Alto and she has to commute every day with her children to the city La Paz, which is a trip of 50 minutes. She attends to breakfasts for all who work from the early hours of the morning, like bricklayers, people who work in factories, with the Municipality cleaning the city, and others. She is a very hardworking person and is a very good mother to her family. She has four school-aged children. One of them has a problem with his vision that has to be treated by a specialist, but unfortunately she doesn’t have health insurance to cover these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of provisions

loans.name: Test

texts.en: T.

loans.use: Test

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. y su esposa Mirna Ivonne Alcaraz tiene cuatro hijos que actual mente están estudiando, pero tiene una problema en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar los exámenes y el pago de la mensualidad.
Don Gerardo V. tiene dos ingresos uno es como empleado en una compañía de trasportes, su segundo ingreso es de arbito los fines de semana, estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia. 
Cuando se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Gerardo el se encontraba en su trabajo, quien nos atendió fue la señora Mirna Ivonne, quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo V. and his wife, Mirna Ivonne Alcaraz, have four children who are currently studying, but at the moment they have the problem of not having enough money to pay for the exams or the monthly tuition payments.

Mr. Gerardo V. has two forms of income. One is as an employee of a transport company, the second is as a referee on the weekends. These are the forms of income that he has for his family.

When we made our visit to the residence of Mr. Gerardo he was at work and we were attended to by Mrs. Mirna Ivonne who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Scholastic support

loans.name: Jilka Mery

texts.es: La sra. Jilka se dedica al negocio desde muy jovencita, lo inició su mamá y ahora ella se hace cargo, vende tucumanas ( empanadas de carne y huevo) en la puerta del mercado, y dentro del mercado en el puesto de su mamá venden, junto a su hermana ropa, regalos, juguetes y cosméticos, son muy conocidas por la zona, su casita queda cerca del puesto y viven ahí la sra. Jilka, con sus hermanas y su mamá, se colaboran y se apoyan, son muy unidas. Es una cliente muy responsable y puntual, el crédito será invertido en la compra de víveres par las tucumanas y en regalos y ropa ya que se acerca el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Jilka has worked in her business since she was very young. Her mother started the business, and now Jilka is in charge of it. She sells tucumanas (fried pastry stuffed with meat and egg) at the entrance to the market. At her mother’s stand inside the market she and her sister sell clothes, presents, toys, and cosmetics. They are very well known in the zone. Her small house is close to their stand. Jilka lives there with her sisters and her mother. They collaborate and support each other; they are very united. She is a very responsible and punctual client. The loan will be used to buy supplies for the tucumanas, presents, and clothes because Mother’s Day is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and merchandise for Mother's Day

loans.name: Jesús Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Gilberto V. está muy agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron con su anterior préstamo.
 Nueva mente está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de material ya que le están solicitando que participe un concurso estatal de proyectos de construcción, el cual le ayudara mucho ha tener mas trabajo y ingresos para su familia.
El desea participar en este concurso por el cual está solicitando su cooperación y así poder participar.
texts.en:
Jesús Gilberto V. is very grateful for the great support he was given with his previous loan. He is asking for a new loan to buy material. They are asking that he participate in making a public tender for state construction projects. This would greatly help him to have more work and income for his family. He wants to submit a tender. That is why his is asking for your cooperation, to be able to participate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: La sra. Yola se dedica a la compra y venta D. cotillones: canastitas, bolsitas, gorritos, piñatas, globos, y demás para las fietas D. cumpleaños y cualquier otro acontecimiento, ella compra toda su mercadería D. la calle La Tablada, un lugar muy conocido en la ciudad donD. se venden varios productos al por mayor, y los lleva a la ciudad D. Oruro donD. tiene su puesto propio y venD. también a otras señoras que le piden mercadería. Vive en su casita propia con su esposo que es músico, trabaja en una orquesta, y con su hija que es estudiante, y en vacaciones viaja con su mamá para ayudarle en el puesto. Es una buena cliente, el crédito será invertido en la compra D. bolsitas D. plástico, y demás regalos para el día D. la madre.
texts.en:
Yola buys and sells gift bags: baskets, bags, hats, piñatas, balloons, and more for birthday parties and other events. She buys all of her merchandise on La Tablada Street, a place well known in the city for selling various wholesale products. She takes them to Oruro city where she has her own stand. She also sells to other women who ask for her merchandise. She lives in her own home with her husband, a musician, and her daughter. Her husband works in an orchestra, and her daughter is a student. During vacations her daughter travels with her to help with the stand. She is a good client. The loan will be used to buy plastic bags and other presents for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic bags and other presents for Mother’s Day

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia D. tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y zapatos usados, esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y desea vender también ropa nueva. 
Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir, portal motivo está solicitando un presta y así realizar la comprar que requiere su negocio.
texts.en:
Leticia D. has been earning her living selling used clothing and shoes for more than two years, providing the income source for her family. Her store needs a wider variety of merchandise, and Leticia also wants to sell new clothing. Right now, though, she does not have the capital to invest, so she is seeking a loan to buy what she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita S. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la preparación y venta de alimentos en su propia casa. En esté momento le está haciendo falta un vehiculo para poder ir a campar el material que necesita para la preparación de la comida que vende. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar el carro que necesita y con más facilidad poder ir a comprar el material, pronto tener el servicio de entrega a domicilio.
texts.en:
Margarita S. has earned her living for more than two years preparing and selling food from her own house. At present she doesn't have a vehicle to go shopping for the ingredients she needs to make the food. She is seeking a loan to buy the car she needs to more easily get her ingredients, and in the near future have a home delivery service.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora María Mercedes R. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía. Pero ella no quiere descapitalizar su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que esta necesitando su negocio, ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda (Verduras, frutas y lácteos) y así tendría mas ingresos su negocio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes R.'s is requesting a loan because her store is in need of a greater variety of merchandise, but she doesn't want to use up all her capital since it's her family's source of income. Her customers are asking her to sell vegetables, fruits, and dairy products, which would allow her business to bring in more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Wilma C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa alquilada.
Su profesión es realizar trabajos de belleza, la misma que lo realiza en su mismo domicilio, pero “quisiera contar con mi propio salón de belleza y que de esta manera mejora mis ingresos para darles una mejor vida a mis niños” Dijo. 
Jacinta C..- vive en el km. 9 barrio el Triunfo, como cacera en la casa de una amiga. Se dedica a la venta d refrigerio (empanadas y refrescos), su esposo el Sr. Armando Rivarona es albañil, el préstamo que solicitaron fue para aumentar su capital de venta de refrigerios. Como objetivo es juntar un capital para comprar su propio lote y poder construir la casita de sus sueños, para poder vivir con toda su familia.
Teresa Eliana Q..- es una de las integrantes del banco comunal, vive en anticrítico por esta misma zona Barrio el Triunfo km.9, con su esposo el Sr. Julián flores y su hijo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa la misma que es realizado ambulando, su esposo es albañil. “Estoy acumulando  mi capital para poder contar de aquí a un tiempito con un puesto fijo ya que se me hace un poco difícil trajinar con mi mercadería y mi pequeño hijo”. Aclaró además que se siente muy agradecida con nuestra institución por haberle apoyado con un pequeño préstamo, con el que podrá aumentar su capital y de esta manera sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilma C. is the president of the communal bank, is 37 years old, a single mother, has 2 children, and lives in a rented house. She works in the beauty profession, a job that she carries out in her own home, however she mentioned that, “I would like to have my own beauty salon to be able to in this way improve my income and give my children a better life.” Jacinta C. lives in the Triunfo neighborhood while she takes care of a friend’s home. She dedicates herself to the sale of snacks and refreshments (empanadas and drinks); her husband Armando Rivarona is a mason. The loan that they are requesting is to increase their capital to invest in the sale of snacks and refreshments. Their objective is to acquire enough capital to purchase their own lot and build the small house of their dreams in which they will be able to live with the entire family. Teresa Eliana Q. is one of the communal bank members; she lives on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over) in the same Triunfo neighborhood with her husband Julián Flores and their son. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing as a street vendor and her husband is a mason. She mentioned that, “I am accumulating my capital to be able to in a while invest in a permanent sales stand given that it is difficult for me to bustle about with my merchandise and small son.” She also made clear that she feels very grateful for our institution having given her support with a small loan, with which she will be able to increase her capital and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital.

loans.name: Ramón Estanislao

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Ramón Estanislao G. le faltan los acabados del interior y exterior de la casa. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la mejora. 
  El señor Ramón Estanislao tiene poco que se quedo viudo y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos y los cuales están estudiando la universidad. 
Solicita el préstamo para realizar las mejoras lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Ramón Estanislao G.’s home is missing interior and exterior finishings. At this moment he does not have the necessary money to carry out the home improvements. Ramón Estanislao recently became widowed and is responsible for two children who are in the midst of their university studies. He is requesting a loan to carry out home improvements as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out home improvements in the interior and exterior of his house.

loans.name: Maria Odilia

texts.es: Maria Odilia es una señora que le gusta ocuparse en algo, desde que ella quedo viuda tuvo que sacar a su familia adelante con otras ocupaciones. Pero ahora se dio la oportunidad de poner un puesto de comida, refresco y frituras. El negocio esta ubicado en un parque muy conocido  de la ciudad y visitado por su misma gente; la señora Odilia ya tiene cinco años vendiendo pero ve que le esta funcionando muy bien y quiere invertirle mas para así tener mas ventas y tener una buena utilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Odilia is a woman that enjoys always being occupied in something; since she became a widow she has had to get her family ahead by finding other occupations. Recently she has had the opportunity to open a food, drink, and fritters stand. The business is located in a well-known market in the city and is visited by her same clients; Ms. Odilia already has been selling for five years and because everything is going well she wants to invest more to increase her sales and make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Jesus Humberto

texts.es:
Jesús Humberto y su esposa son persona que están pensando en el patrimonio de sus hijos. Esta familia le gusta salir junta y sobre todo entre ellos jugar en la parte de atrás de su vivienda. El préstamo que le otorguen lo utilizaran para reforzar ese lazo familiar, ellos quieren levantar la barda atrás de su casa y poner protección para cuando sus hijos estén jugando afuera. También desean aprovecharlo para poner techo para que ninguna inclemencia del tiempo les impida jugar.
Ellos se dedican a vender artículos de belleza por catalogo y trabajan en maquiladora los dos.
texts.en:
Jesús Humberto and his wife are always thinking about the patrimony that they will be leaving their children. This family enjoys going out together, and above all they enjoy playing together in their backyard. The loan that they are requesting will be used to reinforce this family bond; they would like to erect a fence in their backyard to protect their children when they are playing outside. They also hope to take advantage of the loan by adding an awning so that not even inclement weather can impede their play. They dedicate themselves to sale of beauty products through catalogs and also work in a maquiladora (a border assembly factory).

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence and awning.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena C. hails from the beautiful municipality of Morong, Rizal Province, Philippines. She is a 43-year-old woman, widowed, with a son and daughter. Her son, Gerald Kenn, is 22 years old and an undergraduate of electrical technology. Her daughter Cherryl is a third-year college education student.

Rowena joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance Institution and a KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 1999.  Since then, she has had access to capital for her business, rice retail-selling. The business went smoothly and successfully.  During almost ten years of membership in ASHI, she maintained her exemplary performance. 

More recently, she has decided to make transportation her primary business, and she bought a rickshaw which is driven by her son.

Now on her 13th loan, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 pesos to pay for another second-hand rickshaw. The rickshaw will be available for commuters or for the riding public to hire.  Her son-in-law will drive and care for the rickshaw. Rowena is optimistic that her transportation business will grow, as using the rickshaw for transportation is in demand in the town. 

Rowena's dream in life is that someday her children may finish their schooling even though they already have their own families.  As a single parent, she wants to have stability for her future through savings from the profits of her business.

loans.use: To pay for 1 second-hand rickshaw.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunthea K. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a teacher in a local school. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Chrey, is a company employee. This couple has two children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the other is attending the local school.

Now Mrs. Sokunthea K. wants her first child to learn motorbike repair but she does not have enough money to support him. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to provide a better life for her child and improve her family’s living afterwards. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay for her first child to learn motorbike repair

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sengchan

texts.en:
Mrs. SengChan H. is a villager in Praek Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates mangoes. Now her operation has a problem because the field has a lot of insects damaging her produce.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. SengChan H. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides. She would use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to support the field and make it more productive.

She is a 44-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are shoe sellers in the local market while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Pheach

texts.en: Mr. Pheach C. lives in Dei Eth Koh Phous village in Kandal province. He is a cook who has been hired by people for weddings, ceremonies, parties, and so on. His wife, Mrs. Sar Thuok, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates vegetables. However, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which badly affects her crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Pheach C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make the vegetables more productive. He is a 64-year-old father of three children, two of whom are farmers while the other works for a company. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make vegetables more productive.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene P. is from the town of Taguima, in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 49 years old. Irene is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates general store where she sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her business

In 2005, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to to purchase additional inventory. Irene is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the ninth loan that Irene has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use for working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita R. is from the village of Maikay in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 31 years old. Lolita is single. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Lolita has just started this business.

In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and serve as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be the second loan that Lolita has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is from the village of San Nicolas in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old. Josephine is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a manicure and pedicure salon. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her business.

In April 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for her business. This will be Josephine's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loans.name: Analinda

texts.en:
Analinda is married to Benjamin Sr. She is now 37 years old and her family is happily living in Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with four children who are all in school. They want them to finish their studies until college so that they will find a good job some day. With the support of her husband, Analinda is doing her best to improve her business and to earn enough money to support their children's studies.

Analinda's husband is a farmer and, sometimes, she helps him to plant vegetables. Analinda hopes to borrow a loan of PHP 12, 000 so she can develop her store, which is located inside their house. She wants to have a separate stall where she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Yahong in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria helps family members to raise crops on their farm, primarily by planting and harvesting corn to sell. Gloria has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP that she will use to buy fertilizer, such as manure. This loan will be Gloria's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is a resident of Barangay Abinganan in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, Philippines. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education, but due to lack of job opportunities, she never had the chance to be employed in and enjoy her chosen field. She is 27 years old and single.
