Helen Grace manages a typical village store and travels by passenger tricycle to purchase merchandise for her store. She wants to make her business grow, so she would like to borrow PHP 15, 000, which she will use as additional business capital. She hopes that someday, somehow she will be able to increase her income and build her own house with the help of her business and lenders. “Try and try until you succeed” is her simple guiding principle in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela B. is from the village of Yahong,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has six school-age children. Miguela supports her family by raising corn. Miguela has been engaged in this business for over 26 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Miguela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This is Miguela's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Basilides H.

texts.en:
Basilides H. A. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting corn. She is 52 years old, married and has nine school-age children. They are from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Basilides has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 800 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Basilides joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Basilides is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Portacia

texts.en:
Portacia B. is from the village of Duanguincan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Portacia owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products. Portacia has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Portacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Portacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional inventory. Portacia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP that she will use as additional capital to purchase more inventory. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana and her husband George L. live harmoniously with their seven children in a rural community of Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. According to them, “Kung may pagsisikap may magandang kinabukasan” ("when you persevere, there will be a good future"), has served as the guiding principle for their marriage. With some difficulty, they have been able to continue sending their children to school so they may have a good education and eventually a good job. 

Juliana is a vendor in their village. She is hoping to borrow PHP 6,000 as additional business capital. She hopes to generate a higher income by stocking more products, which she can purchase with the loan. She also hopes that her business will be successful so that she can provide more for her family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group comprised of five borrowers, all of whom live in the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. Vet S., 39, is a staff member for a massage club. In addition, she also sells some groceries from the store in her home to her neighbors. She is a divorced mother who now cares for two children, who are minors enrolled in school. Vet S. is a fantastic and very responsible lady who tries to earn money in order to support both her children, providing clothing, daily food, and medical care. Recently, Vet S. has been lacking money to invest her grocery business more successfully. She is applying for a loan through Kiva to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. The other borrowers are jointly taking this loan: 
So S. will use the loan to replace her old motor in order to ride to work more quickly.
Sen S. is a massage club staff member, seeking a loan to repair her house.
Ros S. sells beef soup in her home and she requests a loan to use as capital in her business.
Kit L. will be using the loan to accrue her business capital for selling groceries.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn Y. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Ginalyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ginalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan Ginalyn has taken out through PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Leticia J. was not able to pursue her studies in high school and college. Even still, she worked hard to help her parents earn a living until she got married to Robert J.. They live in a rural community located in Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They have two children, Roxan and Roel. The eldest is now in the fourth year of high school while the youngest is in the fifth grade of elementary school. Despite their hardships, they still have the desire to send their children to school, for they want them to have a better future.

Leticia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 as additional working capital for her store. With this loan, she hopes she will be able to improve her business and increase her daily earnings. With patience and sacrifice, she believes that this hope can become a reality. Leticia shared that she has been doing her best to save as much as she can for her children’s future education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia “Ely” B. was only able to finish her elementary education because her parents were no longer able to finance her studies. Her husband is William B., and they were blessed with four children. They live happily in a rural community located in Barangay Abinganan of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children are presently studying in secondary and elementary school. Ely and William work hard to support and finance their children’s studies, for they want them to earn a degree someday.

Her husband, William, works as a laborer in the Public Market of Bambang while Ely is engaged in buying and selling vegetables at Bambang Public Market. She is requesting a loan in order to help improve her business and earn a higher income. Right now all of her income gets spent on necessities for daily living and her children’s education. As a result, she is unable to finance any growth on her own and is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional working capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Madonna May

texts.en:
Madonna May is commonly called by her nickname, which is “Donna”. She is 30 years old and happily married to Romel M.. They live in a rural place located at Barangay Abinganan of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Having no stable job, it is difficult for them to earn a living since both of them are only high school graduates. Donna has just begun a small retail business so that she can pay for her children’s education.

Her husband cultivates a farm where they plant rice and vegetables. Due to financial difficulty and lack of capital in her store, Donna is borrowing PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of her business. She hopes to utilize the loan wisely and use it as an instrument towards the success of her small business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Seoun's Group

texts.en:
Seoun K. is a borrower who has been chosen to be group leader by the other members of the group loan. Seoun K. is a 63-year-old widowed mother who has given birth to seven children; all seven are married. Most of her children have already started new families. Her husband died of senility years ago. Since 2003, she has had a job as a coconut seller. She also goes to buy coconut in bulk from the people who are full of coconut trees. She also uses her wheelbarrow to transport coconuts to retail them door to door in the community. Seoun K. requested a loan to buy a used motor which she can use to make easier transportation and move more quickly in her business actions. The other two borrowers who have joined this loan are:
H. who sells grilled egg in her village and is asking for a loan to use as business capital
K., a local fish seller, is seeking a loan to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy a used motor

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Lilia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business selling firewood. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
“Due to the economic crisis, life has become difficult, some people are hopeless about their future,” says Marilyn C.. 

No matter what the situation is, Marilyn strongly believes that there is still hope. She is a determined entrepreneur who tried but was unable to afford a college education. Marilyn is doing her best to give her three children the education that she was not able to attain. 

Marilyn manages a little village store. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase additional products to sell. Her husband manages their little parcel of farm land. They help each other to maintain their livelihood for the future of their children.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Maryjean

texts.en:
Maryjean M. believes that being patient and hard working will someday allow her to become a successful entrepreneur. Maryjean patiently manages a hog-raising business to fulfill her responsibility as a mother to provide for her four children. She is the loving wife of Alex M.. She and her family live in Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Maryjean and her husband help each other to earn a living and to support the studies of their children who are in secondary and elementary school.

Maryjean is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of her hog-raising business, which has been running for many years. Her husband served as a BHW (Barangay Health Worker) in their village and is waiting for a very small Barangay Honorarium for his service. Maryjean has had to double her efforts to develop her hog-raising business so that she can give her children a better education. Maryjean is hoping that her loan will be funded because she believes it will be a great help to her business and her family.

loans.use: For her hog farm

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business for local community members at the same time as a RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing business. She is 42 years old, married and has two adult children. They are from the village of Katipunan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Ester has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Ester is now requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Delnie

texts.en:
Delnie L. makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is 31 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Delnie has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delnie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Delnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Delnie is now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Delnie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie and Arnel D. are a young couple who happily live in the rural community of Barangay Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They are both high school graduates and got married after their graduation at a very early age without even thinking of the consequences. Now that they have a two-year-old child, they realize that having a family is not that easy. Regrets come to their minds, but they have nothing to do but to get on with their life choices.

They use an inherited motorcycle for a transport business to earn daily income. Winnie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport business. She hopes that an increase in revenue will pave the way to other sources of income, especially for her. She also hopes to save for the future education of her children. They believe that, with patience and strong determination, they can earn and save more money for the future of their child.

loans.use: For maintenance of a tricycle

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 47 years old and a resident of Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Isabela.  He is married to Florecita and they have three children; two are already college graduates while the youngest is still studying nursing.  Farming is their primary source of income and it also provides for the educational needs of their children. He saysthat helping each other is the best solution to succeed.

Angel manages their farm and sometimes he also helps his wife in managing their sari-sari store (a community-based store).  He wanted to improve their life so he is working hard for the welfare of his family and to meet their needs.
  
He wants to borrow PHP 25,000 as additional capital for their store and to provide for the needs of their customers.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Chan S. and her husband. She is 48 and lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she has been running a business selling a few products for kids in front of her home for a year. As another income source, her husband works repairing vehicles in the village. The modest couple has one child who is married and already took a suitable job as a local rice farmer. Recently, the rains are falling down during this approaching rice season, so Chan S. is looking for a loan on Kiva for her child to use as capital to invest in the rice-growing business.

loans.use: To invest in a rice-growing business

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Clarita C. is the mother of four children: Denver, Christian, Welbor and Maribel, and they live in Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Isabela. Her husband, Wilfredo, is a factory worker in Saudi Arabia. Being far away from one another is difficult, but they need to do this in order to provide the needs of their family and support their children’s education.

To help her husband financially and to send her children to school, Clarita decided to have her own business of hog-raising. In line with this desire, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP30,000 for the maintenance of her business and supply of feed.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Umri

texts.ru: Масобирова Умри-кредитор в Микроинвест с 2006 года. Она берёт замы на расширение своего маленького бизнеса, продажи семечек, конфет чупачупсов и сигарет. Она проживает и торгует на рынке города Худжанда. Умри покупает семечки большими партиями и хорошо их пожарив продаёт их стаканчиками в розницу.  У неё много клиентов , которые любят её вкусные семечки. Поэтому Умри хочет получив кредит закупить семечки по оптовой цене большой партией. Умри благодарит за  поддержку и понимание всех инвесторов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Umri M. has been a borrower at MicroInvest since 2006. She obtains loans to expand her small business of selling seeds, candy and cigarettes. She lives in the city of Khujand and sells at a market there. Umri buys seeds in large quantities, toasts them and then sells them in cups retail. She has many customers who love her delicious seeds. This is why Umri wants to obtain this loan and purchase a large quantity of seeds at a wholesale price. Umri is grateful to all MicroInvest creditors for the support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru: Мансурова Мухаррам 50 летняя женщина , которая работает в фирме «Дусти Амирхон» , которая производит напитки. Она там работает поваром, но из-за нехватки её дохода на проживание, она занимается продажей детской одежды. Товар привозит из Истаравшана раз в месяц. Для закупа летнего ассортимента она хочет подать заявку и получить кредит . Мухаррам довольна всеми условиями фонда.
texts.en:
Muharram M. is a 50-year-old woman, who works at the Dusti Amirhon beverage company. She is a cook there, but because her salary is very small, she is involved in sales of children’s clothing. Muharram brings her merchandise from the city of Istaravshan once per month. She wants to obtain this loan to purchase summer goods assortment. Muharram is satisfied with all of the fund’s conditions.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase summer goods assortment

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо девушка, которой 24 года. Она замужем , имеет двоих детей, основной доход имеет с завоза и продажи женских кофт и верхней одежды. Но с сезоном она хочет в кредит пополнить свой товарооборот летним ассортиментом  женской одежды. Мархабо по бизнесу помогает её муж, он работает частным таксистом на своей автомашине марки «Опель».Поэтому за товаром её муж ездит с Мархабо на своей машине, что им обходится дешевле. Мархабо устраивают условия Фонда и она на снимке она в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a young, 24 year old woman. She is married, has two children and her main income comes from bringing to town and selling women’s cardigans and outerwear. But for the season she would like to expand her summer women’s clothing inventory on credit. Marhabo’s husband helps her in her business; he works as a private taxi driver using his car whose brand is “Opel.” This is why her husband travels with Marhabo for products in his own car, which is cheaper for them. Marhabo likes the terms of the Fund; she is in the photo on the day that she received her loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Орифа женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест с 20020года. Она использует каждый свой кредит на увеличение товарооборота. За период кредитования она расширила свой ларёк, т.к. ассортимент с каждым займом становится разнообразным. Она следующий кредит хочет получить для завоза несколько разновидностей кипятильников и электроприборов. Орифа одна из честных и добросовестных клиентов Фонда.
texts.en:
Orifa has been a borrower at MicroInvest since 2002. She uses each one of her loans to increase her goods turnover. Over time, with each loan, she was able to expand her store by adding variety to her merchandise selection. Orifa wants to obtain her next loan in order to bring in several types of electric appliances. Orifa is one of our honest and sincere clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Farahnaz Group

texts.en:
Farahnaz is the group lender of Farahnaz group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding her business and they want to request a total loan of 56,000 Afghani.

Farahnaz wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving and Semen Gul also wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving.

Anesa wants take a loan for the business of carpet weaving and Nafesa Gul also wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving.

They are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who are able to support all the people in an around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their carpet-weaving businesses

loans.name: Keat

texts.en:
An old medium-sized wooden house in Kompong Tom Province belongs to Mrs. Keat K., 42, who has been established as a small family with other family members for years. She has six children, one of whom is married and lives away from the family home, while the others are students.

Presently, Keat K. and her husband generate their daily income of approximately $4 from selling firewood in the village. Besides their current work, they always have an annual business as rice cultivators. Because the rice-growing season is coming, so Keat K. is applying for a loan to buy a cow which she will use it to plow the farmland and also raise the cow’s offspring in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn H. is a widowed villager living in Kompong Tom Province. She is 50 and the mother of four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. To help meet the family's daily needs, two of her children are working at different occupations.

Vorn H. currently sells a few cooked ingredients in a small store out of her home and she will use the loan money to increase the quantity of grocery items in order to better meet her customer's requirements.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of grocery items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa R. is from the town of Katipunan, Sinacaban. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosa is engaged in planting crops and selling produce such as corn, bananas, cassava, etc. Rosa earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacabn, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Corazon owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic G. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In May 2008, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay the labor on maintenance of the transport vehicle to improve the business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari (variety) store. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Meok

texts.en:
Meok R. is a 42-year-old, married woman and is the mother of four single children; one of whom is working as a rice farmer. She is married to Em Ny, 42, who earns a living selling firewood from home. Meok R. presently raises many pigs in a medium stall behind her house. She sells all her pigs to buyers three or four months after she begins raising them.

Meok R. has requested a loan in order to purchase more food to fatten her family's pigs, as her pigs are nearly ready to sell. Meok R. was not available for photographing, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her pigs

loans.name: Milamel

texts.en:
Milamel M. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Milamel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Milamel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Milamel has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Milamel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milamel has recently successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Milamel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Milamel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication, vitamins and feed for the borrower's livestock. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rosalinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase medication, vitamins and feed for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie L. is from the village of Gata, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosie has been in business for over 12 years and earns approximately 600.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC used to purchase inventory and working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used for the same purposes. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha N. lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She owns a small business in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sok Thol, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple earns little income to support their family's living. Now they want to add a business to earn more income for their family. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to purchase an electric cow for her husband to plow their own field and the other villagers' fields. She hopes to improve and provide a better life for her family. She has two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase an electric cow for her husband to plow their own field and the other villagers' fields.

loans.name: Criscel

texts.en:
Criscel U., 28 years old and married, lives in the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidnetal, where she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products to the local community. Criscel is just starting this business.

In 2007, Criscel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used for the same purposes. This will be Criscel’s third loan PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda L., a 56-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children, lives in the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a business growing crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and selling crops such as corn, cassava, and bananas. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and as payment for labor, Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grown. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn D. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Analyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & selling crops for sale such as corn, cassava, banana, etc. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 Philippine Pesos (about US $32) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
