En Finca, aprendió ahorrar pudo, salir de sus deudas que tenia, esta contenta de estar en el Bancomunal.
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de víveres al por mayor para la preparación de su menú, arroz azúcar, aceite. El sueño que tiene Rosa es que su negocio sea propio, donde ella lo pueda administrar
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89343&_tpos=... Rosa Maria is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She delivers meals daily. She only does this in the mornings. Her customers have increased. Also, in the afternoons she does embroidery with sequins and crocheted knitwear. This is generating another income. In Finca she has learned to save and get out of the debt she had. She is happy to be in her Community Bank. She needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy wholesale supplies like rice, sugar, and oil to prepare her meals. The dream she has is that the business will be her own, and that she can be the one to run it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies wholesale

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89344&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Luz Maria es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz, continúa con su negocio es dar servicio de taxi “TAXI 1” 
En Finca, aprendió a invertir, siente que es un apoyo  económico.
Necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de llantas y mantenimiento al motor de otro de sus carros, el que su esposo lo maneja.
El sueño de Maria, es terminar su carrera de podología  y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
First loan:: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89344&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Luz Maria is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She continues her business of taxi service, “Taxi 1”. In Finca she learned to invest. She feels it is an economic support. She needs a loan for 1,400 PEN to buy tires and do maintenance on the motor of one of her other cars, which he husband drives. Maria’s dream is to finish her career in podiatry and buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motor maintenance

loans.name: Ysabel Petronila

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89345&_tpos=4&_tpg=1
Isabel es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Mantiene un taller de confecciones desde hace diez años, junto con su esposo, también se ha puesto a vender zapatos, y ropa que no confecciona  en su taller a pedidos, para ella es una entrada mas. 
En Finca, aprendió   ahorrar ha sido de mucha ayuda,
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de telas, zapatos para aprovechar las fiestas por el día del padre.
El sueño de Isabel es tener una tienda para vender la ropa que confecciona.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She and her husband have had a sewing shop for ten years. She has also sells shoes and clothes (that were not made in her shop) by order. For her, it is another source of income. In Finca, it has been very helpful to learn how to save. She needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy material and shoes to take advantage of the festivities for Father’s Day. Isabel’s dream is to have a store where she can sell the clothes she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes to take advantage of the festivities for Father's Day

loans.name: Edobor

texts.en: Edobor has a cassava and maize farm. He is 48 years old and married with seven children. He hopes for the loan of N50,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He is saying thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for labor to clear his farm

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es: Rosa Adelia Álvarez V. tiene 48 años, es madre soltera. Rosa tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Rosa tenia muchas dificultades y decido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ropa usada, debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar, por lo que salía a recorrer las calles ofreciendo la ropa, lamentablemente algunas veces no lograba vender mucho, pero Rosa no se dio por vencida y además de salir a vender por las calles también ofrecía sus productos a sus vecinos. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa de cama, ropa para niños, para damas por lo que le permitirán diversificar mas las ofertas de sus productos y así generar un poco de ingresos. Rosa tiene le deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Adelia Álvarez V. is 48 years old and is a single mother. She has three children, all in school. Rosa works in used clothing sales, which she began 3 years ago. She was having many difficulties and decided to do something to improve her family's situation, and began purchasing used clothes because her income was not sufficient to maintain her home. She began to sell these clothes in the streets. Unfortunately, sometimes she was not able to sell much, but she was not defeated. She began to offer the clothes to her neighbors as well. For this reason she is requesting a loan for the capital to buy pajamas, children's clothes, and women's clothes, which will allow her to diversify her products and generate more income. Rose would like to set up a clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz.
Jesús es separada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de  11, 5 y 3 años. que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Jesús estudio secretariado, pero nunca lo ejerció por que se dedico al negocio, trabajo siete años en la venta de cosméticos, repartía a tiendas y puestos  en los campos fériales, cambio de negocio porque le debían mucho, siempre quiso vender licores por que en su zona no había. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió hacer puntual en los pagos y hacer esforzada en su negocio.
Necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de vinos, cervezas, gaseosas, cigarros, chicles.
El sueño de Jesús es poner un video pub
texts.en:
Jesus is a member of the Maria de la Paz communal bank. Jesus is separated. She is 38 years old and has three children, ages 11, 5 and 3, who are all in public school. Jesus studied secretarial work, but did not move forward with it because she dedicated herself to business. She worked in cosmetics sales for 7 years, distributing them to stores and stalls at fairgrounds. She changed businesses because she was owed a good deal of money. She has always wanted to sell alcohol because there is no liquor store in her neighborhood. Since joining Finca, she has learned to make her payments on time and put more effort into her business. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase wine, beer, sodas, cigars and gum. Jesus' dream is to open a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase beverages: wines, sodas

loans.name: Luz Amelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89346&_tpos=2&_tpg=1
Luz Amalia es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz.
Desde hace quince años Tiene una bodega donde vende gas, y sigue haciendo movilidad escolar con su esposo, estos meses ha podido compra un carro mas, le agradece a Dios por que esta surgiendo en su negocio.  
En Finca tiene la oportunidad para surgir como mujer, les enseñan a ahorrar y
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,  para compra de gas y abarrotes para su bodega.
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de taxis.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89346&_tpos=2&_tpg=1 Luz Amalia is a member of the Maria de la Paz communal bank. For fifteen years she has had a store where she sells gas canisters, and she continues to run a school transportation service with her husband. In recent months she has been able to purchase an additional car, and thanks God because her business is expanding. In Finca she has the opportunity to grow as a woman, they teach her to save money. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase gas and groceries for her shop. Luz's dream is to run a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase gas and groceries for her store

loans.name: Vilma Luisa

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del bancomunal Maria D. la Paz.
Vilma es casada tiene 53 años, siete hijos, todos son mayores e independientes.
Se dedica a la venta D. gas , empezó con 2 balones D. gas, ahora venD. 15 balones D. gas diario.
DesD. que esta en Finca, pueD. ahorrar aprendió hacer solidarias.
Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D. gas y D. balones D. gas.
El sueño D. Vilma es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the community bank Maria D. la Paz. She is 53, and married with 7 children, all of whom are older and live independently. Vilma sells natural gas. She began selling two cylinders per day, but now she is up to 15. In her time with FINCA, she has been able to save money, and has learned to stand in solidarity with her fellow members. Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy gas and fresh cylinders. Vilma's dream is that her business continues to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas and fresh cylinders

loans.name: Mercedes Graciela

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89347&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Mercedes es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Junto con un familiar,  tiene su restaurante que  lo administra, en Surquillo, pero quiere abrir un nuevo local por falta de capital, lo esta arreglando poco a poco. 
En Finca aprendió a invertir,  ahora puede compra al por mayor. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para el arreglo de un nuevo local en Tablada.
El sueño de Mercedes es tener un restaurante en su casa, ella vive en Tablada de Lurin..
texts.en:
First Loan Mercedes is a member of the Maria de la Paz Communal Bank. She manages a restaurant in Surquillo that she and a relative own together, but she wants to open a new establishment. This new project is coming together slowly because she lacks capital. At Finca, she learned how to invest and is now able to buy wholesale. She needs a 1000 soles loan in order to set up her new restaurant in Tablada. Mercedes dreams of having a restaurant in her home; she lives in Tablada de Lurin.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a new restaurant

loans.name: Ovieseyi

texts.en: Ovieseyi is 43 years old and married with five children. He has a farm where he grows plantain and pineapple. He is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to hire laborers to clear his farm. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To clear his farm

loans.name: Lloy Gladis

texts.es:
Lloy es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Lloy es conviviente, tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 28, 29 años, .que trabajan.
Lloy   por muchos años se dedico solo a su casa, pero la necesidad  económica, la hizo trabajar, se recordó que en su tierra San Martín su mamá hacia panes, y empezó hacer panes en su casa, comenzó haciendo 60 panes semanal por pedido, se contacto con mas gente, ahora hace y vende 700 panes semanal  y los reparte a tiendas.
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos están ayudando a capitalizarse.
 Lloy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de harina, por sacos, levadura de cerveza, almidón, azúcar, leche. 
El sueño de Lloy es tener una panadería en su casa
texts.en:
Lloy is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She is 56 and in a common law marriage. She has two children, ages 28 and 29, who work. For many years Lloy worked solely on her house. Economic necessity made her do other work. She remembered that her mother made breads where she grew up in San Martín. Lloy started to make bread in her house. She started making 60 breads that were ordered weekly. She made contacts with more people, and now she makes and sells 700 breads a week. She delivers them to stores. Since she has been in Finca, the loans are helping her to invest. Lloy needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy sacks of flour, leavening made from beer, starch, sugar, and milk. Lloy’s dream is to have a bakery in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour, leavening made from beer, starch, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo Jose R. tiene la edad de 44 años, además tiene 1 niño de 6 años de edad y es quien ha sido para el la inspiración y el motor de su vida. Su trabajo es el transporte de personas en triciclo y venta de productos de baño tales como: jabón, toallas, cortinas, adornos, etc., productos que su esposa los elabora y que el sale a vender de manera ambulante, el ya tiene mucha experiencia pues se dedica a este oficio desde hace 13 años aproximadamente, y aunque es un oficio cansado, peligroso y agotador, ha sabido desempeñarse excelentemente pues recorre muchas calles en busca de sus clientes. Esta vez Reynaldo solicita un préstamo que le ayude a sufragar gastos en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de su triciclo e invertir en materia prima para elaborar los productos de baño ya que su meta es tener un ingreso estable e instalar un local que le permita a sus clientes llegar a comprarle.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Jose R. is 44 years old and also has a 6-year-old son who has been his inspiration and driving force.
He makes a living transporting people in his cycle rickshaw and selling bathroom products like: soap, towels, curtains, decorations, etc. His wife makes the products and he goes out and sells them as a street vendor.
Having worked this job for approximately 13 years, he already has a lot of experience. Although this profession is tiring, dangerous and exhausting, he does his job excellently since he covers many streets in search of customers.
This time Reynaldo is requesting a loan to help him pay for the cost of improving and servicing his vehicle, and to also purchase materials used in making the bathroom products. His goal is to have a stable income and to set up a store where customers could come and buy from him.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew is 48 years old and he is married with eight children. He has a farm where he plants maize, plantain and pineapples. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plantain suckers to plant. Matthew sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain suckers to plant

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio R. M. tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos pero todos ellos viven de manera independiente, esta dedicado a la reparación y venta de repuestos electrodomésticos, el inicio este negocio hace 20 años aproximadamente. Desde entonces este ha sido su negocio fuente de ingresos, de esta manera Félix presta servicios como la instalación eléctrica, reparación de abanicos, licuadoras, planchas, televisores, y todo tipo de artículos que tengan relación con su actividad. Félix ha sido una persona que ha tenido que enfrentar momentos muy duros y aunque su mayor preocupación es enfermarse gravemente alega que prefiere morir luchando que jamás haberlo intentado. Esta vez Félix ha acudido a Fundación León 2000 para que se le otorgue un financiamiento el cual le servirá en la compra de herramientas de limpieza para los electrodomésticos como alambres, tomacorrientes, lámparas para mejor visualización y otros equipos que requieren de una cantidad de dinero que en estos momentos el no cuenta pero que los necesita para seguir subsistiendo.
texts.en:
Felix Antonio R. M. is 55 years old and has 5 children, all of whom live independently. He repairs and sells parts for electrical appliances--a business which he started about 20 years ago. Since then, he has offered his services installing electrical equipment, and repairing fans, blenders, irons, TVs, and all kinds of other appliances that might be related to his line of work. Felix has been a person who has had to face some very difficult times, and although his greatest worry is that he will fall seriously ill, he believes that it is better to die fighting than to never have tried at all. This time, Felix has come to Fundacion Leon 2000 for financing that he will use for the purchase of things like wire, electrical outlets, work lights, and other equipment that cost more money than he has right now, but which he needs in order to continue getting by.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ditalala Plus Group

texts.fr: Aniesse K. ne croyait pas qu’un jour dans sa vie, elle pouvait bénéficier d’un appui financier d’une personne qu’elle n’a jamais rencontrée pour renforcer et développer son activité. Elle vend du maїs dans un quartier montagneux à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Aniesse a commencé son commerce en 1990, en vendant des déchets d’habits usagers, abandonnés par des propriétaires pour gagner un petit rien.  C’est pourquoi les gens l’appelaient « Maman manœuvre » qui signifie quelqu’un qui n’a rien comme capital propre, mais vend n’importe quoi au dépend des autres pour survivre. Elle aimait son travail et était déterminée d’avoir un jour son propre capital à partir de ces déchets. De 1990 – 1993, Aniesse accumule des bénéfices et parvient à totaliser un montant de $25 comme capital propre qui lui avait permis d’acheter de bons habits à revendre. De 1993 – 2000, par un dur travail et une bonne gestion et des bénéfices accord accumulés, elle décide de changer l’activité pour se lancer dans le commerce alimentaire. De lors, elle a débuté la vente de 7 sacs de maїs de 50 kilos. De 2000 à ce jour, elle a dans son stock, 13 sacs de maїs de 50 kilos. Actuellement, son capital est de $250 et son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $25 par semaine. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu au mois de mai dernier lui a servi d’acheter 3 sacs de mais pour renforcer le stock en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt des maїs et celui des boissons. Aniesse est âgée de 42 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient de 6 à 23 ans. Le plus âgé des enfants est indépendant et deux seulement des autres enfants vont à l’école. Elle est une cliente fidèle de Hope qui a reçu trois fois les crédits qu’elle a remboursés totalement et à temps.
texts.en:
Aniesse K. didn’t think that one day she would be able to obtain financial support from someone who she never met for the purpose of bolstering and developing her business. She sells corn in a mountainous district, west of Kinshasa. She started her business in 1990 by selling used clothing, discarded by owners, to earn next-to-nothing. This is why people call her “Maman Manœuvre”, which means someone who has nothing in the way of capital but who sells no matter what merchandise and is dependant on others to survive. She liked her work and was determined to have her own working capital one day, apart from these cast-offs. From 1990-1993, Aniesse accumulated profits and managed to total $25 in capital, which had enabled her to buy good clothing to resell. From 1993-2000, through hard work, good managing, and accumulated profits, she decided to switch to another business, getting started in the commerce of food. As such, she began by selling seven 50-kg sacks of corn. Since 2000, she has had her own stock of goods, thirteen 50-kg sacks of corn. Currently, her capital amounts to $250, and her business generates for her a profit of $25 per week. The loan she obtained last May was used to buy three sacks of corn for bolstering her inventory with the aim of growing her profits. Her ambition is to open an outlet for corn and for beverages. Aniesse is 42 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, ranging in age from 6 to 23. The eldest is on his own, and only two are going to school. She is a loyal customer of HOPE who received loans three times and who repaid them completely and on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of corn for resale and to grow her business revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is the single mother of three children. She sells Sukumuwiki (like Kale) at the Jubilee market in Kisumu, Kenya. She purchases her goods from wholesalers who bring it in from Nandi Hills. Rose's main hope for the future is to expand her business so that she can take care of her children. She describes her main challenge as dealing with the fluctuation in customers between high and low seasons (usually revolving around the harvest).

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Rose saying “Idhi Nade”, which is Luo for “How are you?” Rose responds, “Adhi maber,” meaning “very good.” Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama’s father. At the end, you will hear the interviewer fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying “Asante Sana” in Kiswahili, meaning “thank you” and “Erokamano”, which in Luo means “thank you.” The voices in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Vegetables

loans.name: Marixsa Dominga

texts.es: Marixsa Dominga Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Marixsa tiene 2 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos y venta de repuestos electrónicos. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Marixsa no es una mujer de edad avanzada por lo que esto no le impidió salir adelante, y por este negocio es que sus hijos lograron estudiar y formarse en la vida. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo siempre destinado para su negocio en la compra de azúcar, leche, un poco de granos básicos. Su sueño es de salir adelante para que su negocio no fracase.
texts.en:
Marixsa Dominga G., 59, is married. Dona Marixsa has 2 children and works independently. She operates a business selling dairy products and electronic parts. She's operated the business for more than 13 years. Marixsa isn't that old so her age isn't an impediment to getting ahead and the business is for her children, to help them finish school and prepare for life. The loan is for working capital and, ultimately, for buying products such as sugar, milk, some basic grains for resale. What she most wants is that her business doesn't fail.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Millicent Auma

texts.en:
Millicent is the 40-year-old mother of three children. She is raising them by herself as her husband passed away. She sells clothes in Kisumu, just off the main street. She hopes to expand her business and make enough profit to purchase a cow. The cow will serve as both an extra source of food as well as a buffer against food insecurity should she face it in the future. 

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Millicent saying “Idhi Nade”, which is Luo for “How are you?” Millicent responds, “Adhi maber,” meaning “very good.” Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama’s father. At the end, you will hear the interviewer fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying “Asante Sana” in Kiswahili, meaning “thank you” and “Erokamano”, which in Luo means “thank you.” The voices in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona Gómez tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y la actividad económica a la que ella esta dedicada es a la venta de mercadería en general, ella se inicia en este rubro siendo una madre abandonada pero que con mucho valor decidió enfrentar su situación e invirtió unos ahorros que tenia en la compra de mercadería, de esta manera pudo hacer clientela quienes le compraban al contado y al crédito, al principio fue un poco difícil, pues sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no tenia clientes fijos por lo que tenia que caminar largos trechos para conseguirlos. Ella nunca opto por dejar a sus hijos, ya que siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y cuidadosa, gracias a Dios ella ha podido enfrentar todo lo que ha su vida se ha aproximado, y hoy en día se siente muy satisfecha por su valentía y ánimos de luchar por la vida. Ella desea un financiamiento para invertir en su capital de trabajo donde el inventario de más urgencia que necesita son: zapatos, cosméticos, pantalones, ropa para niños, perfumes, entre otras.
texts.en:
Pabla Petrona G., 43, has 2 children and operates a business selling general merchandise. She started the business when she was abandoned, already a mother, but facing her situation with great bravery and investing some savings that she had in the purchase of merchandise for resale. She then built a customer base, some buying from her with cash and others on credit. At first, it was a bit difficult since her children were small and she didn't have a regular customer base that she could depend on. She had to walk long stretches to find customers. She never chose to leave her children because she's always been a responsible and caring mother. Happily, she's managed to face all that life has thrown at her and she's pleased that she's found the strength and courage to do it. She wants a loan for working capital which she'll use to buy the products that she most urgently needs: shoes, cosmetics, pants, children's clothes and perfumes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Selene

texts.es: Maria Selene B. T. tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de edades adolescentes y 1 de un año de edad, ella se dedica desde muy joven a la costura la que fue una actividad que su propia madre le enseño, y aunque ella tiene otro oficio decidió quedarse trabajando en este desde que su esposo quedo desempleado, sin embargo de sus malos momentos sacaron buenos frutos ya que de la liquidación que se le dio a su esposo decidieron comprar telas para empezar a vender ropa hecha por ella misma, de esta manera ella cosía y confeccionaba estilos de ropas y su esposo le ayudaba en ir a venderlas, hoy en día esta es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, Maria Selene elabora: sacos de vestir, vestidos de novia, trajes, pantalones, y muchas mas prendas, sin embargo Maria necesita un financiamiento que le permita invertir en este negocio para comprar telas, agujas, botones, broches además darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser y mejorar unos estantes de muestra para exhibir sus atuendos.
texts.en:
Maria Selene B. T., 44, has 2 older children and 1 one-year old baby. She has earned money as a dressmaker since she was very young, work that she learned from her mother, and though she has another trade, she decided to dedicate herself to this line of work when her husband became unemployed. Her husband's bad luck had a silver lining, though, because they decided to buy material and sell the clothes that she makes. She sews and makes clothes and her husband helps her to sell them. The business is now the main source of income for the family. Maria Selene makes jackets, bridal gowns, suits, pants and many other clothing pieces. Maria Selene needs a loan that will allow her to invest in the business. She will buy material, needles, buttons, etc., and service her sewing machines. She also wants to improve the display shelves where she exhibits her outfits.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda Calderón tiene 62 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Dolores tiene un negocio cono lo es la venta de productos de belleza y ropa,  el cual es distribuido de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 8 años y lo encontró como una manera de ganarse la vida, principalmente como una alternativa por el alto nivel de desempleo. Dolores inicio con muy poca cantidad de cosméticos distribuidos principalmente a personas conocidas como sus amistades y familiares, después fue ampliando su negocio hasta ofertárselo a mayores cantidades de clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería como cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, pinturas de uña, pintura de labios entre otros. Los sueños de Dolores son de ampliar cada día mas su negocio de tal manera que sea un ingreso para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores Yolanda Calderón, 62, is a single mother. She has three children who all work independently. Dolores sells beauty products and clothes as a street vendor. She started this business eight years ago, and she found a way to make a living. Primarily, it is a good alternative to the high level of unemployment. Dolores started with a very small amount of cosmetics, which she mainly distributed to people she knows like her friends and family. Later, her business was growing and she could offer her products to more customers. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy merchandise like creams, perfumes, deodorants, nail polish, and lipstick, among other things. Dolores’ dream is to expand her business every day in such a way that it becomes an income for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Badeya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier N’kola de la sous-préfecture de Fakola (région de Sikasso, république du Mali)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parentés et de voisinage. Elles font entre autre l’achat et la vente d’articles divers, la restauration etc depuis 5 ans. Elles ont une très bonne réputation est connue  de  tous dans le secteur. 
Suite à la croissance du nombre de leur clientèle, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 300kg de riz, des tubercules (100kg de pomme de terre, 50kg d’igname, 50kg de patate douce), 100kg de poissons fumés ou séchés, 50 paquets de cube maggi et 50kg de sel de cuisine. Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Fakola auprès des forains et effectuent leurs ventes, aux forains, aux voyageurs, aux ménagères et revendeurs des villages environnants.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, le reste ajouté au fonds de commerce.
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Badeya are married women who average 32 years of age and 2 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the N’kola district of the sub-prefecture of Fakola (region of Sikasso, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their businesses have included the buying and selling of various goods, food catering, etc. for five years. The women have a very good reputation and are known by everyone in their fields of business. Following the growth in the number of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 300 kg of rice, some tubers (100 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of yams, 50 kg of sweet potatoes), 100 kg of smoked or dried fish, 50 packets of Maggi cubes, and 50 kg of salt. Supplies are procured at the Fakola marketplace from fair vendors. Sales are made to fair vendors, travelers, housewives, and retailers of the surrounding villages. The group members each hope to realize a profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to repay the loan, and the rest will augment their working capital. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work, such as selling cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and condiments for the restaurant business

loans.name: Ines Alfonso

texts.es: Inés Alfonso E. G. tiene 55 años de edad ya esta casado y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales seis viven de manera independiente y la menor de 14 años aun esta bajo su responsabilidad. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de granos básicos, se inicio en este rubro económico ya que era profesor y su salario era tan bajo que decidió experimentar con la venta de cerdos, esto le ayudo mucho pero no era lo que el había esperado, asi que nuevamente experimento con la compra y venta de granos básicos la que le ha dado buenas ganancias, desde entonces su negocio ha prosperado considerablemente pues ha logrado comprar cada vez mas cantidad de granos básicos a los productores, y aunque ha sufrido muchos problemas de salud ha podido mantenerse firme y  ha logrado preparar a sus hijos mayores con una buena educación y aun sigue con su hija pequeña, para la cual el desea verla toda una profesional con buenos valores. Su más grande deseo es comprar un camión de carga que le permita transportar artículos desde el norte del país.
texts.en:
Ines Alfonso E. G. is 55 years old and married with 7 children. Six of them live independently and the seventh is 14 and still lives at home. Ines works buying and selling staple grains, a business he started as a high school teacher when his salary was so low that he decided to try out selling pigs. This helped him much more than he was anticipating, and from there he moved on to his current venture which has been very profitable. Since its beginning, his business has prospered since he has been able to buy more grains from the wholesalers each time, and although he has had many health problems, he has stayed strong, and has managed to provide his older children with a good education. His youngest daughter is still in school, and he wants to see her grow up to become a successful young woman with solid values. Ines' deepest wish is to buy a bulk truck which will allow him to transport grains from the northern part of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jose Arístides

texts.es: Jose Arístides B. vive en el municipio de Guazapa departamento de San Salvador, Jose vive con su esposa y su hijo. A sus 61 años Jose sigue trabajando con la ayuda de esposa y  también su hijo han logrado sostener y sacar adelante su negocio;  la familia posee un molino que tiene ya 12 años de dar servicio, ahora Jose ha ampliado su negocio ya tiene un pequeño inventario de paletas y por las tardes la esposa de Jose hace tortillas para vender, mientras los dos hombres de la casa Jose y su hijo se encargan de los clientes que llegan al molino. Jose solicita este crédito para hacer una inversión en su negocio del molino.
texts.en:
Jose Arístides B. live in the Guazapa municipality of the San Salvador department. He lives with his wife and son. At 61 years of age, he keeps working with help from his wife and son. They have managed to maintain and get ahead in the business. The family has a mill. They have been providing services for twelve years. Now, Jose has expanded his business. He has a small inventory of popsicles. In the afternoons his wife makes and sells tortillas while the two men of the house, Jose and his son, take care of the customers who come to the mill. Jose is asking for this loan to make an investment in his milling business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his mill

location.town: Guazapa, en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Lolo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge 30 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le  quartier N’kola de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
Elles ont spécifiquement comme principale activité génératrice de revenus la restauration et cela depuis 7 ans. Elles ont  leur restaurant situé au cœur du village qui est un point d’escale pour les voyageurs et commerçants en provenance de la république de la Côte d’Ivoire (une république sœur qui fait frontière  avec cette localité de  la république du Mali). 
Pour satisfaire le besoin sans cesse croissant de cette clientèle, ce groupe  a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1000kg de riz, 500kg de petit mil, 100kg de haricot, 500kg de pommes de terre, de la viande,  du poisson et le reste sera utilisé pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement dans le marché de Fakola auprès des forains et effectuent leur vente dans le dit marché à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Lolo group are all married and have an average age of 30 years and 2 children. They live in large traditional families in the N'kola neighborhood in the Fakola subprefecture, in the Kolondièba prefecture (which is in the Sikasso region in Mali). Their main revenue-generating activity is a restaurant and has been for 7 years. Their restaurant is situated in the heart of their village and is a stopover point for travelers and merchants coming from Côte d'Ivoire (a sister country bordering this area of Mali). To meet the ever-increasing customer demand, this group has decided to turn to the microloan institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which the group is on its third solidarity loan. Their previous loans were all repaid in full with no problems. The women hope to use this loan to purchase, 1000 kg of rice, 500 kg of small millet, 100 kg of beans, 500 kg of potatoes, beef, and fish and the rest will be used to purchase a large amount of condiments. The women purchase their stock in the Fakola market with traveling merchants and sell their goods in the market to a diverse and affluent client base. They each hope to make 60,000 CFA in profit that will be used to pay the interest on the loan, provide for their families, and invest back into their business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restaurant

loans.name: Santos Adelita

texts.es: Santos Adelita Rodríguez G. tiene 35 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos uy todos estudian. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La actividad económica es la pulpería. Ella decidió incursionar en este negocio por la mayoría de sus amistades le recomendaron que estableciera este tipo de negocio en su vivienda, y comenzó estableciendo una mesita de golosinas, pan, galletas entre otros, con el paso de el tiempo es que ha logrado incrementar su pequeño negocio y con la ayuda de los financiamientos. Santos solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, sopas instantáneas, jabón y detergente. Su sueño es obtener un mini súper y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos Adelita R. G. is a 35 year-old single mother. She has 3 children, all of whom are in school. For more than 10 years, Santos has run a small neighborhood grocery store, which she started at the recommendation of many of her friends. She began with a small table of sweets, bread, crackers, etc., and with time--and the occasional loan--she has been able to expand her small business. Santos is soliciting financing for the purchase of staple grains, candy, instant soups, soap, and detergent. Her dream is to start a small supermarket and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. is a 28-year-old mother of three children. She is married to a businessman who sells second hand belts. She has a small boutique just outside of the main downtown area in Kisumu. She buys her clothing stock from Busia, which is on the border with Uganda. This is her first loan.

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Eunice saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Eunice responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, the interviewer fluctuates between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you," and "Erokamano," which in Luo means "thank you." The voices in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/


K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To purchase clothing stock

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. is the mother of five children and grandmother to ten children. She is unsure of her age, but guestimated (off-camera) it's around 70. She sells reed mats and vegetables in Dunga Beach, about 5 kms outside of Kisumu. She will use the loan to buy more bamboo for weaving and to buy more vegetables. Her main challenge is short finances and she sometimes must use her own vegetable stock, normally used for selling, for food. Her hope for the future is to receive a loan and improve her lifestyle. This is her first loan. 

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Monica saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Monica responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, the interviewer fluctuates between Kiswahili and Luo, saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you," and "Erokamano," which in Luo means "thank you." The voices in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/


K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To buy materials for making reed mats, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tagnè Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Tagnè sont toutes mariées. Elles  ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Koko de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font l’achat vente de plusieurs céréales (arachide, haricot, mil …) et autres articles divers. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 500kg de farine de blé, 100kg de riz, 200kg de maïs. Elles s’approvisionnent en farine de blé à Gueya (un village de la république sœur de Côte d’Ivoire), en riz et maïs dans le marché hebdomadaire de Fakola auprès des producteurs. Tandis que la farine de blé est vendue aux détaillants et boulangers du village, les céréales elles, sont vendues aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Kolondièba, Bougouni, Bamako etc.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités génératrices de revenus.
Elles ont pour ambition d’ouvrir des magasins de vente dans le marché de Fakola.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tagnè are all married. They average 32 years of age and 4 children each. And they live in traditional extended families in the Koko district of the sub-prefecture of Fakola, in Kolondièba prefecture (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship and community. They buy and sell several kinds of grains (peanuts, beans, millet,...) and various other goods. To satisfy their burgeoning customer base, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy 500 kg of wheat flour, 100 kg of rice, and 200 kg of corn. Supplies of the flour are gotten in Gueya (a village of the sister republic of Côte d’Ivoire); the rice and corn, at weekly markets of Fakola from producers. While the flour is sold to retailers and bakers in the village, the grains are sold to retailers from large cities, such as Kolondièba, Bougouni, Bamako, etc. The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover family expenses, and to invest the rest in income-generating businesses. Their ambition is to open shops at the Fakola marketplace.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and grains

loans.name: Dionisia Eulalia

texts.es: Dionisia Eulalia B. Martínez tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 que se dedica a este negocio. Inicialmente comenzó su negocio asociándose a una compañía de maquillaje y productos femeninos, y fue así como logro apoderarse del mercado. Dionisia solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, cosméticos, bisuterías, bolsos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para darles a sus hijos un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
Dionisia Eulalia B. M. is 48 years-old and is not married. For the past 5 years, she has sold general merchandise, a venture which she got into doing sales for a make-up and feminine product manufacturer. This was how she was able to stake out a place in the marketplace. Dionisia is asking for a loan for the purchase of underwear, cosmetics, imitation jewelry, bags, etc. Her wish is to expand her business and give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Lucia es viuda, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Lucia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes. Además Lucia tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. bebidas.
Lucia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pescado y bebidas.
Los sueños D. Lucia son ampliar sus negocios y que su hijos sea profesional.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. Lucia is 54 years old, a widow and has 7 children. Lucia works every afternoon selling food as a street vendor in the Magdalena market. Lucia also runs a small store from her home, selling refreshments. Lucia needs a 1050 soles loan to purchase fish and beverages. Lucia dreams of expanding her businesses and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and beverages

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: La Señora Martha Petrona M. L. tiene 42 años de edad. Su estado civil es casada. Tiene un hijo y todavía no estudia. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Martha es una persona muy responsable y tenía la responsabilidad de su hijo, la vivienda de Martha es la más humilde de su comunidad. Es por eso que Martha decide incursionar en este negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. El sueño mas grande de Martha es mejorar la condición económica del país y que la ayuda que reciben las personas que quieran salir adelante con su negocio permanezca.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Petrona M. L. is 42 years of age, is in a civil marriage and has a son who is not yet in school. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics and she's been doing this for more than five years. Martha is a very responsible person and is responsible for her son. Martha's house is the most humble in her community and that's why she decided to get into this business, in order to improve her family's living conditions. The money that she is requesting is for working capital to buy clothing, perfumes, beauty creams and cosmetics. Martha's greatest dream is for the country's economic condition to improve, and that the help received by people who want to get ahead with their businesses will continue.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Esther es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Esther junto a su esposo vende abarrotes en general en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los transporta con un carro alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la selva.
Esther necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Esther sueña con construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of Communal Bank Marcela. She is 29 years old, and lives with her husband and their 2 children. Alongside her husband, Esther sells groceries in the Ayacuchana Jungle, and transports her goods with a rented car. They sell their goods at different market days around the jungle. Esther needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which she will invest in purchasing rice and sugar. Her dream is to build her own home and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha Elena Rubí Hernández tiene la edad de42 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de brindar los servicios de un salón de belleza. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocos recursos ya que anteriormente era muy difícil conseguir todas las herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos, con el poco dinero que acumulaba lograba comprar productos de tratamientos para el cabello. Es una mujer que ha sufrido mucho en la vida, no le impide seguir adelante con su vida. El dinero que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de planchas para el pelo, secadora, sillas y productos para el cabello. Sus sueños son de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Elena Rubí Hernández is 42 years old, and a single mother with 2 children. Professionally, runs a beauty shop, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She began with very few resources, as it was very difficult to get all the necessary equipment for her work. With the little bit of money she accumulated, she was able to buy hair care products. Martha is a woman who has suffered quite a bit during her life, however, this does not prevent her from moving forward. The money that Martha requests will be used as capital for her business, to buy things such as chairs, hair dryers, curling irons, and hair care products. Her dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Socos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Socos, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Socos.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, comidas, ropa, animales menores, frutas, la agricultura y la elaboración D. telares.
	
Como es el caso D. Elva que es separada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Elva venD. cereales en la ciudad D. Pisco a donD. viaja semanalmente, los cereales los compra en su distrito. Además Elva se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, arveja y haba.
	
Mientras que Florentina es casada, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Florentina junto a su familia tienen un taller D. telar y bordados, realizan trabajos como carteras, tapetes, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,000 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arveja, haba, lana, arroz, fideo, azúcar, trigo, cebada, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios , comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, tener un puesto estable y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Socos is beginning its 3rd cycle with 18 members. The members come from the Socos district. The members all have different jobs, such as grocery sales, food sales, clothing sales, small animal sales, and agriculture sales. Take the case of Elva, for example, who is 30 years old and separated with 2 children. Elva sells basic grains in the city of Pisco, where she travels weekly. She purchases the grains in her district. In addition, Elva also grows potatoes and peas. Florentina is 28 years old and married with 3 children. Florentina and her family have a weaving workshop, where they make items such as rugs, which they sell in the city's artesanal market. The bank members need different loan amounts, such as 300, 600, and 900 Soles, combining for a grand total of 13,000 Soles for the Communal Bank. The money will be invested in the purchase of peas, wool, rice, noodles, sugar, wheat, and small animals. The members' dreams are that their children can complete their studies, to purchase a car to transport their products, and to construct a house.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peas, wool, rice, noodles, sugar, wheat, and small animals.

loans.name: Lilian Marina

texts.es: Lilian Marina R. R. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Lilian esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos Henry de 16 años de edad y Raquel de 13 años de edad ambos asisten a la escuela. Lilian cuenta con el respaldo económico de su esposo ya que él es taxista pero los ingresos no son suficiente para los gastos que sostiene mes a mes la familia, es por ello que Lilian sale de su casa a su negocio ubicado en un puesto en Tonacateque , Lilian vende variedad en cosméticos , fruta y refrescos . Ella solicita un crédito por que quiere comprar la suficiente mercadería para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lilian Marina R. R. lives in the municipality of Tonacatepeque located in the department of San Salvador. Lilian is in a relationship and lives with her two children, Henry, age 16 and Raquel, age 13. Both of whom are in school. Lillian receives financial support from her husband who works as a taxi driver but his income is not enough to cover the expenses of the family for the whole month. This is the reason why Lilian has her own business located in Tonacateque. Lilian sells a variety of cosmetics, fruits and sodas. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy enough merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Cipriano Javier

texts.es: Cipriano Javier R. Hernández tiene 35 años de edad es padre de familia y tiene tres niñas, su vivienda esta ubicada en uno de los lugares mas pobres de su localidad, sin embargo el ha sido un hombre esforzado por su bienestar y el de su familia, la actividad económica de Cipriano es la elaboración de artesanías de forma manual. Inicio este negocio para proporcionar a su familia el sustento, la educación y la estabilidad económica. El señor Cipriano inicio como ayudante en la elaboración de artesanía lo que permitió aprender a fabricar piezas de barro que se venden en el municipio de La Paz Centro, a nivel nacional e internacional. El financiamiento que necesita Cipriano es para comprar materia prima que le permita elaborar sus artículos ya que el anhela transportar sus productos a una feria que se realizara en el mes de Noviembre en Miami y con este dinero comenzar a trabajar con capital propio
texts.en:
Cipriano Javier R. H. is 35 years old and is a father of three girls. His home is located in one of the poorest places in his location. However, he has made an effort for his well being and his family. The economic activity of Cipriano is the manual elaboration of crafts. He started this business to offer his family sustenance, education and economic stability. Mr. Cipriano started as an assistant in the elaboration of crafts which allowed him to learn how to make mud pieces that are sold in the municipality of La Paz Centro at a national and international level. The financial support that Cipriano needs is to buy raw material that will allow him to elaborate his crafts. Cipriano wishes to transport his products to a fair that takes place in the month of November in Miami. This money will allow him to work with his own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Audelys Isabel

texts.es: Audelys Isabel M. M. tiene la edad de 41 años, ella tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 20 años respectivamente. Audelys se dedica al destace de cerdos desde hace 11 años, para el inicio de este negocio, su esposo le dio la idea de comprar un cerdo para engorde y luego matarlo para vender su carne,  ellos vieron que en este negocio había rentabilidad, de esta manera decidieron no solo destazar cerdos sino también reces y todo tipo de ganado, además alquilan sus tierras para que los animales puedan comer pasto, esta actividad en un comienzo la realizaban dos veces al mes, años mas tarde al cambiar de domicilio empezaron a destazar grandes cantidades de animales, en donde Fundación León 2000 ha sido una mano amiga por medio de financiamientos, y asi sigue deseando una excelente preparación para sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia, ya que esto es lo de mas valor que el podría dejarles a su familia. Audelys precisa de un financiamiento para comprar al menos 10 vacas al mes, para aumentar sus ganancias y proyectar su negocio como una microempresa, además ayudar a sus padres quienes por su vejez han estado un poco enfermos.
texts.en:
Audelys Isabel M. M. is 41, and has 2 children, ages 17 and 20. Audelys has been a pig farmer for the past 11 years. To begin this business, her husband gave her the idea to buy a pig to fatten and then slaughter to sell its meat. They realized that this business was profitable, and decided to begin fattening all types of livestock animals. They also began to rent out their land for grazing purposes, which they initially did twice a month. Years later, they moved to a new home and began to fatten even more livestock. Fundación León has been financial help in this regard. Audelys continues to desire an excellent preparation for her and the well-being of the family, as this business is the most valuable thing she could leave for the family. Audelys needs a loan to purchase at least 10 cows per month, in order to increase her income and increase her business as a small business. She also needs to help her parents, who, do to their old age, have been a bit ill.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia Pérez tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. Rosa Emilia se dedica a la compra-venta de cosméticos y ropa en general, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Hasta la fecha doña Rosa Emilia ha estado trabajando con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 y nuevamente hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: trajes para niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos, además comprar tallas grandes y extra grandes ya que estas  cuestan encontrarlas y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas, también artículos cosméticos como: delineadores, pinturas labiales y de uñas, polvo, brillos, tintes, cremas, perfumería entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia Pérez is 36 years old, and has 3 children who all work independently. Rosa Emilia works as a cosmetic saleswoman and clothing saleswoman. Since she began, Rosa has established a fixed customer base, which has provided her with enough income to cover her household expenses. She is a single mother. To this day, Rosa has been working with financing from Fundación León 2000. She is now asking for a new loan to purchase certain items, such as: outfits for boys, teenagers, and adults, and to purchase large sizes for her clients. Rosa wants to expand her business, and also purchase cosmetic products such as: eye liner, lipstick, nail polish, creams, perfumes, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Isidra

texts.es: Maria Isidra G. L. vive Apopa ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, Maria está acompañada vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, Jose de 8 años de edad y Glenda de 7 años de edad, ambos niños asisten a la escuela. Aníbal la pareja de Maria se dedica a la crianza y reventa de ganado con estos ingresos el logra aportar económicamente a la familia pero Maria no queda de brazos cruzados en su casa, ella también ha buscado hacer su negocio y ahora ha logrado estabilizar una venta de productos como ropa y zapatos. Maria sale de su casa todos los días y se va a vender de manera ambulante a otros departamentos de El Salvador como Sonsonate, San Miguel, San Salvador entre otros. Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su inventario de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Isidra G. L. lives in Apopa, in the state of San Salvador. She lives with her partner and their two children, José, who is 8 and Glenda, who is 7. Both children attend school. Anibal, Maria's partner, raises and sells cattle, and supports the family with his income. Maria doesn't sit at home with her arms crossed, however. She also works and has established a business selling products like clothing and shoes. She goes out every day and is a traveling sales person in other states of El Salvador such as Sonsonate, San Miguel, and San Salvador, among others. Maria is requesting this loan to increase her inventory of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Alexandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Alexandra C. López tiene 27 años, es madre soltera y no tiene hijos. Alexandra se dedica a la actividad económica como es la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central. La Señora empezó este negocio hace mas de 6 años,  tiempo en que inicio debido a que su familia ha estado en este negocio desde hace tiempo, y es por eso que nace esta idea en Alexandra. Sus inicios se dan con muy poca cantidad de ropa, ya en su mayoría de clientes siempre solicitaban productos como  ropa para niños, y con el tiempo es que ha logrado incrementar un poco su inventario. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de trajes para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y sabanas. El deseo de Alexandra es seguir con vida para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alexandra C. López is 27 years old. She is a single with no children. She sells clothing in the central market. She started her business more than 6 years ago, and got started in this line of work because her family had been in it for some years, which gave her the idea. She started with very little clothing, as most of her customers always requested children’s clothing, and over time she has managed to increase her inventory a bit. The money she is requesting is a capital investment for the purchase of women's dresses, men's clothing, children's clothing and sheets. Alexandra's wish is to stay alive to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos esta conformado por Mayra Modesta G. R. y Paz Catalina S. en la actualidad ellas no cuentan con el capital de trabajo a suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios. Paz Catalina S. tiene 66 años. la actividad económica es de brindar el servicio de Nintendo, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leña y con el tiempo obtuvo algo de ganancia compro ropa usada la cual distribuía en su barrio y mas tarde logro un triciclo y posteriormente con las ganancias que recibía de ahorro lo suficiente para la compra de Nintendo, a pesar del desafío que atraviesa cuando se acerca el invierno es que su casa se inunda, pero este inconveniente solo hace que los sueños de Catalina se realicen como son de seguir creciendo con este negocio.  Mayra Modesta García R. tiene la edad de 36 años. Es madre soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este negocio surgió por idea propia y realmente se dio cuenta de que rápidamente almacenó algunos ingresos. Y ahora deciden realizar un financiamiento para que invertir en sus pequeños negocios que por ser pequeños no sean importantes. Ambas son amigas y lo que sueñan es que sus negocios sigan adelante.
texts.en:
The Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos is made up of Mayra Modesta G. R. and Paz Catalina S.. Currently, they do not have enough money to increase the inventory of their businesses. Paz Catalina is 66 years old. Her business is a Nintendo service. She used to sell firewood, and over time she took her profits and purchased used clothing which she sold in her neighborhood. Later on, she was able to purchase a three wheeled cart and eventually with the earnings she saved enough to buy the Nintendo. When winter approaches her house floods, but this inconvenience only helps Catalina achieve her dreams of continuing to grow this business, despite the challenges. Mayra Modesta García R. is 36 years old. She is a single mother and has one child. She sells new and used clothes. She came up with this business on her own initiative and realized that she quickly earned income. Now they have decided to request a loan to invest in their small businesses, because although the businesses are small they are still important. They are friends and their dream is that their businesses continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción D. tiene la edad de 50 años, es una madre soltera. María tiene a su cargo 2 hijos y ambos estudian. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de poseer este medio de vida labora en un hospital de enfermera, por lo que su vida es muy complicada ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para atender a su hijo y recurrir a su trabajo, los fines de semana los dedica a visitar a sus amistades para realizar la venta de sus productos. María se ha beneficiado mucho con los financiamientos porque todos han sido con el fin de ayudar de sacar adelante su negocio, es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de belleza, cremas, cosméticos, ropa para mujeres y caballeros. El sueño de María es la preparar a sus hijos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María de la Concepción D. is 50 years old and is a single mother. She has two children in school. She has had a business selling general merchandise for more than 3 years. She also works in a hospital as a nurse; therefore her life is very complicated as she has to get up very early to take care of her child and go to work. On the weekends she visits friends to sell her products. María has benefited a lot from loans since they have helped her get ahead with her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase beauty products, creams, cosmetics, women's clothes and men's clothes. María’s dream is to educate her children and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Salome es soltera, tiene 62 años y 3 hijos, Salome tiene una distribuidora de gas, el local esta en su casa, la venta es al por mayor y menor, para lo cual cuenta con empleados que llevan el producto a domicilio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de balones.
Los sueños de Salome son incrementar sus ventas y tener otros puntos de venta.
texts.en:
Salome is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 62 years old, single, with 3 children. Salome has a business selling gas. Her shop is in her home. She sells wholesale and retail, and has employees who do home delivery, which she does with the help of her children. Salome needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will use to purchase propane tanks. Her dream is to increase her sales and have additional locations.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of propane tanks

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es:
Tarcila es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Tarcila es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Tarcila tiene una vidriería en su casa llamada San Cristóbal, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, además D. los vidrios venden vitrinas, para lo cual cuenta con 1 empleado.
Tarcila necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aluminios.
Los sueños D. Tarcila son aumentar sus productos.
texts.en:
Tarcila is a member of Obreras ('Workers') community bank. She is 62-years old, married, and has four children. Tarcila has a glass shop called San Cristóbal in her house; she runs the business with her husband. In addition to glass they sell glass display cases, for which they have hired an employee to help with. Tarcila needs a loan of 2,600 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of aluminum. She dreams of increasing the products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum

loans.name: Gloria Leida

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Gloria es soltera, tiene 45 años y 1 hija, Gloria vende panes, pasteles variados que son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza a trabajadores de distintas instituciones, además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y cosméticos.
Los sueños de Gloria son educar a su hija en la universidad y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 45 years old, single and has a daughter. She sells bread and a variety of pastries which she acquires in Lima. She sells to workers in various businesses. She also does catalog sales of cosmetics. She needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will use to purchase bread and cosmetics. Her dreams are to be able to send her daughter to college and to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread and cosmetics

loans.name: Juana Natividad

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Juana es separada, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Juana vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en un avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza por las mañanas, Juana tiene proyectado aperturar un local para vender el cebiche.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas para el nuevo local.
Juana sueña con construir su casa de material noble y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. Juana is separated. She is 54 years old and has two children. She sells ceviche on a well traveled street in the mornings. She plans to open a shop to sell ceviche. Juana needs a loan of 600 soles to purchase tables for her new locale. She dreams of building a home from solid materials and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables for her new locale.

loans.name: Ndena

texts.en:
L. is married and has six children. He has a farm in Atoukichum Mejang. There he plans to use his loan to farm lots of cocoa and plantain. Some of the loan will be used to cover the cost of transportation. 

This is L.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. At age 63 he has experience as a farmer. He says he has a successful operation because he “works hard toward the business”.

Having experienced death and illness in his family, along with poverty and stolen property, L. has lived a long life. Earning a profit from this loan will help him to pay for his children’s school fees, invest in the small business sector, do repairs on his house, as well as acquire some small equipment items for his house.

L. takes out GHAPE loans because he can make small, frequent payments to pay back the loan. Also, GHAPE has taught him how to better manage his money. 


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Cocoa Seed, Plantain Suckers and Transport

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una Bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo, además Reyna tiene una casa donde alquila cuartos, Reyna tiene proyectado construir con material noble su casa y trasladar su tienda a su casa.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Reyna sueña con construir de material noble su casa y tener una tienda mas amplia.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 32 years old, single, with one son. She has a shop in a rented location where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat every day with the help of her son. She also rents out rooms in her house. She plans to build a cement block home and move her business to her house. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase soft drinks, rice and sugar. She dreams of building a cement block house and having a larger store.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Eulalia tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, además Eulalia por las tardes vende salchipollos en la puerta de su tienda.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Eulalia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 51 years old, lives with her partner and has 7 children. She has a shop in a rented location where she sells groceries and vegetables. In the afternoon she also sells salchipollos (a dish of French fries with shredded chicken and hot dogs) in the doorway of her shop. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase rice and sugar. Her dreams are to provide a good education to her children and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Samfien

texts.en: A. is married to two wives and has six children. A. not only has a farm, but also raises pigs. With this loan, he plans to purchase two piglets, three bags of pig feed, fencing and labor to clear his farm. A. believes his business will succeed because he works hard and is honest with his customers. Having had failure with his business in the past, he knows what does not work. This is A.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. With the profits from this loan he will pay for his children’s school fees and provide for his family needs. A. takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of GHAPE membership require you to pay back the loan in regular, small installments, which works well for A..
