About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two piglets, pig feed, fencing and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Wungeh Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and has five children. In Bailem, Cameroon, Joseph is an operator, and he cuts firewood using a chain saw. Firewood is used a lot in Cameroon, as most kitchens cook over open, wood-burning fires. His services are common. He will use this loan to purchase petrol (gas), engine oil, a chain saw and some sharps. Joseph says he is a hard worker and is kind to his customers. These characteristics are what he believes makes him a successful business owner. In his community, his business location allows his customers to trek shorter distances and it will enable him to employ local youth. This is Joseph’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2008. With the profits from this loan he will pay for his children’s school fees, save some money, rear pigs and perhaps buy some trees. Joseph takes out GHAPE loans because GHAPE documents his loans and is a truthful organization. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy petrol (gasoline), engine oil, a chain saw and sharps

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is married with two children. Raising pigs in Belo, Cameroon is his primary source of income. With this loan Eric will buy three piglets, five bags of feed, wooden fencing, and vaccinations for the pigs.

Eric believes that he will raise his pigs well because "I work with my wife." He also notes his plans to work hard so that he may earn the highest income. He knows that he has to be present in order to be successful.

This is Eric's second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He used his last loan to tend to his pigs, as he will do with this loan. Eric takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of GHAPE membership require you to pay back the loan in regular, small installments, which works well for Eric. With the profits from this loan, Eric will pay for his children's school fees, add a little to his business, and generally help his family to lead a better life.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy 3 piglets, pig feed, fencing and vaccinations.

loans.name: Prodencia

texts.en:
Prodensia S. is married and has six children. Her hometown is Belo, Cameroon where she sells koki beans and palm oil in the Mejang Market. Prodensia purchases these items in bulk and sells them at retail prices. With this loan she plans to purchase koki beans, three tins of palm oil, a bag of groundnuts (peanuts) along with her transport costs.

Prodensia knows her resale business will do well. She knows that "people need koki bean to prepare they things with." Koki beans are commonly used to prepare local dishes in Cameroon. A particular favorite, which is often sold on the street, is a deep-fried, Madeline-shaped finger food. It can be served with Pepe (hot pepper) sauce. The tins of palm oil she plans to purchase are more like large barrels and the palm oil is a deep red-orange color.

Prodencia has faced sickness and death in her family and notes that she "hates stealing." With the profits from this loan Prodensia plans to buy seeds, yams and koki beans for her farm. Most families have a farm in Cameroon. A lot of times, too, the farm is a small or long walk from your compound.

This is Prodensia's second loan from GHAPE since she became a member in early 2008. She takes out GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are preferable.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy koki beans, palm oil, groundnuts (peanuts), and her transport.

loans.name: Nges Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah S. is married and has one child. He lives in Belo, Cameroon and sets up shop in the Belo Market. Elijah buys and sells goods at his general store. With this loan he plans to purchase one bag of rice, two cartons of soap, a half carton of dry fish, three bags of Maggi (a popular seasoning in Cameroon), one roll of sugar and two buckets of Gari.

Elijah believes his business will succeed because he sells the basic necessities that people need. He also works hard and is good to his customers. Financially, Elijah sells his products at moderate prices and thinks ahead by saving some of his money in a credit union.

Although Elijah has had some obstacles, such as fire destroying his plantain farm and learning how to run a good business, he is still trying. With the profits from this loan, Elijah looks forward to paying his child's school fees, saving some of it with GHAPE, buying plantain to plant in his farm, increasing his business and contributing to his Njangi group.

Njangi groups in Cameroon are an informal way to lend money. Each month a different member collects the group's dues and may use it for whatever they please. It is very prevalent, as you can see groups dressed in their distinct uniforms around town, near the time they meet.

This is Elijah's second loan from GHAPE since he became a member in early 2008. Elijah takes out GHAPE loans because "of their truthfulness" and the way in which everything is documented. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap, dry fish, maggi (a seasoning), sugar, and gari to resell.

loans.name: Juana Salavdora

texts.es: La Señora Juana Salvadora García C. tiene 49 años, es madre soltera. Salvadora tiene un hijo que estudia y trabaja con ella. La actividad económica es la elaboración de arreglos florales. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que su Mama la inscribió en un curso para este tipo de manualidades, con el tiempo Salvadora le puso mucho empeño para sacar adelante a su familia y con el apoyo de su hijo deciden establecer una floristería a pesar de los problemas de salud que Doña Salvadora presentaba como problemas lumbares, esto no la detuvo para seguir adelante porque además tenia que sustentar las necesidades de su hogar. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de velillos, rosas, papel, alicates entre otros. El deseo de Salvadora es que sus arreglos sean de la mejor calidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana Salvadora García C. is a 49 year old single mother. She has a son who attends school and works with her. She had had a business making flower arrangements for over 9 years. She got started after her mother enrolled her in a class for this type of work. Salvadora put in a lot of effort to improve her family’s situation and with her son's support they decided to open a florist’s shop. Salvadora's health problems, such as lower back problems, have not stopped her from making progress because she has to provide for her family's needs. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of cellophane, roses, paper and wire among other things. Salvadora's dream is for her arrangements to be of the highest quality for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio M. C. tiene 26 años, es un joven soltero. La actividad económica de este joven es venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alexander es un joven con muchas ganas de trabajar, y esto lo impulso a buscar este medio de trabajo, por lo que recorre las calles ofreciendo su productos y lo realiza con una sonrisa y brindándoles a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan. Por lo que los financiamientos le ayudan a incrementar su inventario. Es por eso que solicita este capital de trabajo para la compra de calcetines, ropa interior, toallas, camisolas y shorts. El sueño de Alexander es establecer un negocio en un lugar determinado y además lograr estudiar.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio M. C. is 26-years old and single. His work activity is clothing sales, which he has worked in for more than seven years. Alexander enjoys working and this characteristic prompted him to begin working in sales; he travels the streets offering his products with a smile and delivering the products that his customers need. Financing helps him increase his inventory, that's why he is requesting this working capital loan to purchase socks, underwear, towels, camisoles and shorts. Alexander dreams of establishing his business in a store location and also of continuing his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Canaria Group

texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Canaria” are from the Community of Canaria, Canaria District, Province of Victor Fajardo. The community has a population of approximately 300 “comuneros.” The community is located six hours away from the city of Ayacucho and is primarily sustained by farming and raising livestock.

The members of the bank are involved in different activities, like Flora who is married with an 8-year-old son. Flora has a stO. in her house, where she sells basic groceries. Flora started this stO. when she was young. The loan she hopes to get will be invested in the buying of mO. merchandise to sell in her stO.. Flora dreams of her son becoming a professional.

Felicitas is married and has two children, 10 and 12 years old. Felicitas has a grocery stO. in her house, where she also has Internet stations. Her children help her in their free time. With the loan she hopes to obtain, she is going to invest in buying mO. groceries. Felicitas aspires to move forward and to raise her children well.

Marisol lives with her partner and has an 8-year-old son. Marisol has a car with which she transports passengers and sells groceries at different fairs in the region. At the fairs she also buys cereals. With the loan Marisol hopes to obtain, she has plans to buy groceries and cereals. Marisol dreams of saving up money and educating her son.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cereals to sell

loans.name: Bernarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Bernarda de la Concepción A. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Su esposo labora también trabaja con el fin de ayudar a su esposa y sacar adelante a su familia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocas cantidades de ropa, y al ver que sus clientes respondieron decide invertir un poco mas, Bernarda es una mujer que le gusta luchar, a pesar de que algunas veces tenga que viajar y recorrer muchos kilómetros. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como ropa para niños, ropa para caballeros, para damas y además sobrecamas. El sueño de Bernarda es ampliarse con este pequeño negocio, que algún día podrá convertirse en una tienda.
texts.en:
Bernarda de la Concepción A., 46 years old, is married and has 4 children. She works selling clothes. Her husband also works to help her and to support the family. She has been working in this business for 10 years. She started with very small quantities of clothes, and when she saw that her customers responded, she decided to invest a little more. Bernarda is a woman who likes to work hard, even though sometimes she has to travel, covering many kilometers. The money that she requests is for working capital to be used to buy goods such as children's, men's and women's clothing as well as bedspreads. Bernarda's dream is to develop her small business so that one day she can start a store.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 48 años D. edad y es madre D. 04 hijos, D. estado civil casada, y tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (2do D. primaria).  Vive en el Barrio Central D. Queñuani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles logró implementar su negocio D. compra y venta D. aji.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprará aji al por mayor y luego lo venderá en Desaguadero.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para obtener más ganancias.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones  D. su  Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She attended elementary school but did not finish (2nd graD.). She lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business buying and selling aji chiles. She now needs to borrow 2500 PEN to invest in her current business. She will buy the aji at wholesale and then resell it in Desaguadero. She wants to continue working in order to earn more. She enjoys the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aji chiles

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años edad estado civil casada y es madre D. 07 hijos (todos ya casados e independientes solo 01 esta a su lado), y tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (3ro D. primaria), y vive en el Barrio Central D. Queñuani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  pudo comenzar su negocio D. compra y venta D. sacos D. polietileno (plástico).  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio y vender sus productos en las ferias D. yunguyo.

Su deseo es poder comprar ganado para mejorarlo y que tengas crías para luego venderlos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 7 children (all of them are married and independent, only one of them still with her). She attended elementary school but did not finish (3rd graD.) and she lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business buying and selling plastic bags. She now needs to borrow 500 PEN to invest in her current business and sell her products in Yunguyo's markets. She wants to be able to purchase cattle to raise and then be able to sell the calves. She enjoys the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags

loans.name: Cecilia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años edad, estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos (todos a su cargo), y tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en el Barrio Central de Queñuani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.  Cecilia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de productos artesanales.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio la compra y venta artesanías para luego venderlos en las ferias del la zona.

Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando para poder ayudar  a sus hijos en sus estudios.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ya que en ella se divierte mucho
texts.en:
Cecilia belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children (all depending on her). She has an elementary school education and lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN Cecilia was able to start her business buying and selling handcrafts. She now needs to borrow 3000 PEN to invest in her current business, buying handcrafts and then selling them in area markets. She wants to be able to keep working in order to help her children with their education. She likes the meetings because she has a lot of fun there.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handcrafts

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 65 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos (3 D. ellos ya están casados y 03 viven a su lado), la sra. Máxima es casada, y no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Barrio Progreso sector plaza D. armas.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  Máxima comenzó su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores para engorD..  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra D. ganado menor: vacas y ovejas los cuales los compra en las comunidades D. Yunguyo.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para poder ayudar D. alguna manera a sus hijos a que continúen sus estudios.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  y las reuniones  D. su  Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Máxima belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 65 years old and the mother of 6 children (3 are married and 3 live with her). She is married and has no formal education. She lives in the Plaza D. Armas section of Progreso neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN Máxima started her business buying and selling young animals to be fattened. She now needs to borrow 3000 PEN to invest in buying livestock - cows and sheep that she buys in communities in Yunguyo. She wants to keep working in order to be able to help her children to continue with their studies. She enjoys the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows and sheep

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Santa Catalina” are from the centre of Cuyocc, Anco District, Province of Churcampa and Department of Huancavelica. The community has a population of approximately 1500 co-proprietors. The city is primarily sustained by cultivation of corn, wheat, potatoes and other products.

Octavia lives with her partner and has three children. Octavia sells various clothes in her district. She began with only a few assorted products and now her business has grown. With the loan she hopes to obtain, she will buy more clothes to diversify her business. The dreams of Octavia are to obtain more products and to support her children in becoming professionals. 

Donatilda is married and has two children, aged 12 and 14. Donatilda buys and sells smaller animals, like chickens and guinea pigs. Her loan will be invested in the buying of chickens and guinea pigs.  The dreams of Donatilda are to have more capital and to buy large animals and support her children in their education.

Maribel is married and has four children. Maribal started selling fish and, with her first loan, she changed her business to sell clothes at fairs. With the loan she hopes to obtain, she has plans to buy a broader variety of clothes. The dreams of Maribel are to buy a loom in order to make sweaters and to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos, de estado civil casada, y tiene estudios de Secundaria completa, y vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi  ½ año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  Elizabeth tiene su negocio de compra y venta de ají.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra y venta de ají, paralelamente se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, el mismo que lo compra en las comunidades de su zona.

Su mayor sueño es convertirse en mayorista de aji.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y gracias a ellos a salido adelante sola aprendiendo a negociar.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has a high school education and lives in the Central neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost half a year. With an initial loan of 500 PEN Elizabeth started her business buying and selling aji chiles. She now needs to borrow 1000 PEN to invest in her current business, buying and selling aji chiles. At the same time she buys and sells livestock, which she buys in the communities in her area. Her biggest dream is to become a wholesale seller of aji chiles. She likes to save, and thanks to her savings has been able to get ahead, learning to negotiate.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aji chiles and livestock

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La señora Daniela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos (3 D. ellos ya están casados), la sra. Daniela es casada, y tiene estudios D. Primaria completa, y vive en el Barrio Progreso D. Queñuani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  Daniela pudo iniciar su negocio D. compra y venta D. ají.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra y venta D. ají. El mismo que es vendido en las ferias D.  Desaguadero

Su mayor sueños construir su casita para poder vivir mejor, ya que ahora esta viviendo en la casa D. sus papas, también le gustaría poner una tienda para su vejez.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  sus utilidades y las reuniones cuando comparten con sus compañeras del Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Daniela belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 52 years old and the mother of 6 children (three of them are already married). Daniela is married, has an elementary school education, and lives in the Progreso neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN Daniela was able to start her business buying and selling aji chiles. She now needs to borrow 3000 PEN to invest in her current business, buying aji and then reselling it in markets in Desaguadero. Her biggest dream is to build a little house to improve her life, since she currently lives in her parents' house. She would also like to start a store for when she is older. She likes to save and earn, and the meetings where she gets together with the other members of the Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aji chiles

loans.name: Las Productoras De Patahuasi Group

texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Productoras D. Patahuasi” are from the community of Patahuasi, Vischongo District, in the Province of Vilcashuaman. The community can be found at 3600 meters above sea level. The principle activities of the community are agriculture and raising livestock.

The members of the bank are involved in different businesses. For example, Yolanda, who is married with 5 children, sells cheese that she first buys in markets. Previously she was dedicated to buying and selling small animals. With the loan that she hopes to obtain, she will invest in buying cheese. Yolanda hopes that her children will become professionals and that her family will better itself.

Maximiliana is married and has five children. Maximiliana and her husband have a grain mill where they offer the service of grinding flour and where they also process purchased cereal. The loan that Maximiliana hopes to obtain would be invested in buying mO. cereal and maintaining the mill. Maximiliana dreams that her children will become professionals. 

Dina lives with her partner and 3 children. She has a grocery stO. in her house where she sells basic groceries. She does this with the help of her spouse. With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will buy mO. groceries. Dina dreams that her children will study at university one day and that her business will improve.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, groceries, cereal and to pay for maintaining a mill.

loans.name: San Luis De Huancapi Group

texts.en:
The members of the “San Luis de Huancapi” are from the district of Huancapi, Province of Victor Fajardo, which is located 4 hours outside the city of Ayacucho. The principle activities of the region are raising livestock, commercial enterprise and agriculture. 

Ana is a single mother of an 8-year-old son. Ana has a store in her house where she sells basic groceries. She also sells gelatin desserts that she makes herself. She needs a loan of 200 soles that she will invest in buying groceries. Ana’s dream is to expand her business and she dreams that her son will become a professional.

Alicia lives with her partner and she does not have children. Alicia sells cosmetics from catalogs. Alicia needs a loan of 200 soles to invest in a new business of making picarones (sweets made with flour and sweet potato). Alicia’s dream is of expanding her business and having a pharmacy.

Georgina lives with her parter and she has three children. Georgina sells gasoline in her district, a business that she has developed little by little. Georgina needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in buying gasoline. Georgina’s dream is to expand her business and to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy groceries, gasoline, diversifying a business.

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1 Group

texts.en:
Hoyo del Toro is a small community on the side of the road to San Pedro de Macoris. Yicer A. (group coordinator) is married to Filiberto Heredia and they have 4 children. Yicer sells different kinds of food. Her best selling items are mabi (a Dominican drink made of boiled roots) and sorbet-like ice cream. With summertime approaching, she expects these sales to pick up, so Yicer will use this loan to buy fruit and plastic bags for the ice cream, and bottles for the mabi drink, along with the roots to make it. Yicer expects her sales to allow her to expand her business and make it into a cafeteria. Yicer wants to see her children choose a profession freely, graduate and have successful lives in the workforce. 

Please help us support Yicer's dream, along with the other entrepreneurs in this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell more portions.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra P. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, está es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Está solicitando un préstamo para liquidar el pago de un pedido que realizo ya que  los clientes que le encargaron el producto ya no le quisieron pagar, y ella tiene que solventar el pago si no le cancelan el crédito. Para la señora Alejandro es importante conservar su contrato con la compañía de belleza solo con ese ingreso cuenta para salir a delante con su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandra P. has been working for more than three years selling beauty products from catalogs. This is her family's source of income. She is requesting a loan to pay off an order that she placed, because the customers who requested the products refused to pay her. She needs to pay for the order to avoid having her credit canceled. It is important to Alejandra to maintain her contract with the beauty products company, because that income is the only way for her and her family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment to supplier

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 2 Group

texts.en:
Hoyo del Toro is a small community just before getting to San Pedro D. Macoris. It is so small that there is not enough business for a lot of small entrepreneurs who live in the area, so they must go to other locations to sell. Spending money on transportation diminishes their profits and the time they spend with their families. 
Solitaria S., this group's coordinator, is single and has 3 children. She sells clothes for a living and will invest this loan (her 6th) on more merchandise. She hopes to relocate to a larger town where she can sell from home all the time and not travel as much. She also wants to continue saving money from her business profits to have provisions for the future. 
On behalf of Solitaria and this group of entrepreneurs, thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres, su esposo Joel y sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la provincia de Huaral, desde hace más de 14 años, incursionando en este negocio, debido a su madre quien desde muy niña la incentivó para que la ayudara en el negocio. Gracias a ello, hoy en día, Flor posee un espacio al costado del puesto de su madre, donde ofrece variedad de vegetales, los cuales compra al por mayor. A Flor siempre le ha gustado la interacción que tiene con la gente, ya que siempre es muy carismática con todas las personas que le solicitan algún producto, logrando que éstos sean muy fieles a su negocio. Por otro lado, la parte difícil radica, en pasar casi todo el día en su puesto de trabajo soportando los cambios del clima, pero ella sabe que son gajes del oficio que debe sobrellevar. Para un futuro cercano quiere tener un negocio mucho más grande donde pueda vender en mayor cantidad. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela que día a día crece más.
texts.en:
Flor is 27 years old, lives with her parents, her husband Joel and her two small children in their own home. She sells vegetables in one of the most well-known markets in the Huaral province, for more than 14 years, because her mother persuaded her to help with the business since she was very young. Thanks to this, she now has some space next to her mother's stall, where she offers a variety of vegetables that she buys in bulk. Flor has always enjoyed the interaction she has with people, since she is very charismatic with everyone who asks for her products, making them loyal to her business. On the other hand, the hard part is being all day at her stall withstanding the changes in weather, but she knows these things come with the job. In the near future she wants to have a larger business where she can sell more quantities. This is the first loan she has with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she promises to be very punctual with her payments. With this money she will buy a larger quantity of produce to satisfy the necessities of her clientele, which grows more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of produce purchased

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Isabel E.  viven en una casa de renta junto con su esposo y tres hijos.
El costo de la renta se ha incrementado y cada vez es más difícil para ella cubrir ese gasto.
Por tal motivo está tramitando un crédito para obtener su propia casa por mediante Infonavit(Crédito Gubernamental) Sin embargo el valor de la vivienda es mayor que el crédito que puede recibir, ya que su sueldo es bajo.
Por ello está solicitando un préstamo para completar el valor de la vivienda y obtener propia vivienda y darle un lugar más seguro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra Isabel E. lives in a rental home with her husband and three children. The cost of rent has increased and it's harder for her to cover this expense. For this reason she is asking for a loan to get her own home through Infonavit (Government credit). However, the price of the house is more than the credit she can receive, since her salary is so low. Because of this she is asking for a loan to meet the price and obtain her own home to give her children a safer place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meet the amount of the down payment for a home financed through Infonavit (Government Credit)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la confección de artesanías, tales como pulseras, aretes y collares elaborados a base de semillas, mostacillas y otros materiales que hacen que el acabado final sea muy bonito, teniendo muchos clientes en su vecindario, los cuales adquieren sus artículos. También teje chompas de lana, las cuales son muy bien cotizadas en esta época de invierno, cuando la temperatura es cada vez más fría. El negocio va bien y Gregoria quiere hacerlo crecer, pero sabe que eso no será nada fácil, porque el solo hecho de tejer una chompa le toma dos días y producir en gran cantidad se le hace más complicado. Su deseo es poder conseguir a una persona que la ayuda a producir en mayor cantidad, felizmente a Gregoria le gusta su trabajo, por lo que lo hace con alegría, obteniendo siempre muy buenos acabados. Este es su primer préstamo individual, y seguirá con la misma responsabilidad que la caracteriza, pues cuando trabajó en bancos comunales siempre fue muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que esta vez está solicitando, comprará gran cantidad de material para elaborar sus artesanías, además de lana para tejer sus chompas y así producir en mayor cantidad y generar mayores ingresos para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 39 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She makes manual crafts like bracelets, earrings, and necklaces made with seeds and other materials which make the final product very pretty. She has many customers in her neighborhood who purchase her products. She also knits wool jumpers which are very well priced at this time of winter, as the temperature grows colder. The business is doing well and Gregoria wants to make it grow, but she knows this won't be easy since the process of knitting a single jumper takes two days and producing a larger quantity is more complicated. Her wish is to hire someone who can help her produce larger quantities. Gregoria happily enjoys her job, that she does with joy, getting always nice finishes. This is her first individual loan, and she will continue with the same responsibility that characterizes her, because when she worked in communal banks she was always very punctual in her payments. With the money she is now requesting she will purchase a large quantity of material to make her crafts as well as wool to knit her jumpers and this way produce a larger quantity to generate more income for all of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for arts and crafts

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel P. ya ha sido acreditado de FVP el cual pago puntualmente. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo más moderno y más variedad de productos para vender en el salón de belleza. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esa inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para que su negocio tenga más variedad y mas ingresos para su familia ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus padres que son ya personas de edad mayor.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel P. has already received one loan from FVP and he paid it punctually. Now he is requesting another loan to purchase more modern equipment and a greater variety of products to sell in his beauty salon. At this time, he lacks the funds necessary to make this investment and he doesn't want to leave his business under-capitalized. This is why he seeks your cooperation: so that his business can have more variety and he can earn more income for his family, including his parents who depend on him now that they are elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his beauty salon

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina V. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta inventario pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer esa inversión, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo la comprar de mercancía que su negocio requiere, y así tendría mas ingresos para ella y su esposo ya que son personas mayores de edad y solo tiene el negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina V. has sold groceries for a living for more than four years. This is the source of income for her family. The business needs inventory, but she doesn't have the necessary funds to make that investment, which is the reason why she is asking for a loan to purchase the merchandise that her business needs. She would have more income for her and her husband, as they are older and only have the business to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Krang

texts.en:
Krang C. is 54 years old and lives in Pursat Province, in Cambodia. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to seven children: six are married and have ready started new families, while the other one is single and employed as a motorcycle taxi driver.

At present, Krang C. has a job as a local farmer. As another income source, she is buying and selling natural fertilizers and rice for a profit. Krang C. will use the loan to purchase a motorbike in order to make transportation easier and to use as capital to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Nguon D. is 48 year old, married, and the father of five children. He is a requirement worker in the village. Two of his children sell snack foods at the boat port. Nguon is married to Ly Yon, 49, who sells cakes for kids in the village. He requested a loan for his wife to purchase a necessary ingredient to produce the cakes she sells. The loan will help the family to accrue the income they need to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cakes

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda C. is a banana vendor. She earns a reasonable profit from selling snack items like banana chips, boiled bananas, and fried bananas to the her neighbors who while away their time talking as they sit on the outside benches. Leonarda is 53 years old and has three children. Her husband, Honorato C., drives a motorcycle taxi. 

Leonarda has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase bananas. The loan will help her increase the number of bananas that she sells and earn a larger income for her family.

Because of CEVI, Leonarda is better able to support her family. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase bananas

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
This group has chosen Mr. Seng M. to be their group leader. Seng M., 33, is married and has three children who all attend the local secondary school. Seng is a fisherman who catches fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. He and his wife usually wake up very early each morning to prepare their tools for fishing. Then they sell the fish in the busy local market. Recently, they have not been able to catch as many fish as before because their tools frequently break down. Therefore, Seng M. is applying for a loan to buy additional fishing equipment so they can catch more fish. 

The other three borrowers who are taking this loan are:
Mr. Eak T.,  a local fisherman, who is asking for a loan to repair his old house.
Mrs. Ek C., who will use the loan to increase the size of her house.
Mrs. Toem C., a fisherman, who will use the loan to purchase more fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 69 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Antonieta owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products. Antonieta has been engaged in this business for over 40 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month.

In 2000, Antonieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Antonieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that she will also use to purchase additional products. This loan will be her 24th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna D. is from the village of Southern Looc. Lorna, 56, is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a food stall where she sells herbs and spices. Lorna has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 44,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional inventory. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products. This loan will be her 26th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita J. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Anita runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp to the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn U. is a 34-year-old mother of one child and owns and manages a sari-sari store. She works hard at her business so that she can bring home the bacon. She has been selling various types of goods at the store since 2006. She is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 from CEVI to purchase additional stock of merchandise to sell. She believes that by doing so, she can attract more customers and increase her income.

CEVI provides financial services to economically active poor in Philippines. CEVI not only gives loans but also provides trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia E., 36, is from the town of Lopez Jaena. Celedonia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Celedonia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Celedonia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns ~6,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Celedonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celedonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Celedonia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen S., 39, is from the town of Plaridel. She is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. Ellen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida D. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 48 years old. Nida is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nida operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Nida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina H. A. vive en Apopa municipio de San Salvador, Rosalina tiene 48 años de edad actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo quien es ya mayor de edad. Rosalina cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo ya que el aporta económicamente al hogar, pero Rosalina buscando una manera para subsistir por si sola ha logrado  montar un pequeño negocio en su casa, donde tiene en venta productos de belleza y uso personal, como perfumes, cremas corporales, maquillaje, etc. Rosalina solicita este crédito  por que quiere surtir su inventario de mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosalina H. A. lives in the Apopa municipality of San Salvador. Rosalina is 48 years old and currently lives with her life partner and her son who is now older. Rosalina counts on the financial support of her son as he contributes financially to the household, but Rosalina is searching for a way to subsist. Therefore, by herself, she has managed to start a small business in her home where she sells beauty and personal products such as perfumes, body creams, makeup, etc. Rosalina asks for a loan because she wants to stock up her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise to stock her business

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: 036-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hà N. Thị is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hà is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 036-Quảng Hưng (18-01-036).

Hà is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Hà makes and sells rice products in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.442.600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products. This will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. Thị Vân is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.

2. N. Thị Lan is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hà N. Thị (73) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 036-Quảng Hưng (18-01-036).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Vân (71) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  N. Thị Lan (69) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin D. was born in 1968 and is a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been operating a farming business in the village for more than five years. She normally grows rice and vegetables. She is also flexible, growing through the conditions of different seasons. 

She is married, with four single children, all of whom are students and work with her business when they are not studying. Another source of the family’s income comes from her husband, who works as a domestic wooden-house builder.

Ngin D. will use the Kiva loan to buy a cow and use it to plow the farmland during this coming crop season. She will also raise its offspring.

A person who shown in the picture is Mrs. Ngin D.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing and breeding

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria del Carmen A.  vive en el municipio de Jayaque departamento La Libertad. Maria vive con su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto de 4 años. . El esposo de Maria se dedica a la agricultura y aporta mensualmente 100$, estos ingresos no son suficiente para los gastos familiares es por ello que Maria también trabaja y se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado en Lourdes Colon donde comercializa todos sus productos y no siendo suficiente este trabajo Maria también hace pupusas para vender los días sábado y domingo. Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar mercadería para aumentar su inventario en ropa.
texts.en:
María del Carmen A. lives in the city of Jayaque, dept. of La Libertad, with her husband, two children and a four-year-old grandson. Maria's husband is engaged in agriculture and he contributes $100 monthly, but these earnings are not sufficient for the household expenses. That's why María also works selling clothing. She has a small stand located in Lourdes Colon where she sells all her products. And that's not all; María also makes pupusas to sell on Saturdays and Sundays. María is requesting this loan because she wants to buy merchandise to increase her inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: 027- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lộc  N. Thị is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lộc is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 027- Quảng Hưng.

Lộc is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Lộc manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. Lộc has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lộc  joined Thanh Hoa FPW to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lộc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa FPW. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional raw materials. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa FPW. Lộc  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  P. Thị Gấm is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.

2.  N. Thị Tuỳ is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  N. Thị Tơ is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Lộc  N. Thị (56) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Lộc  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 027- Quảng Hưng (18-05-027).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng đất sét cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lộc  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lộc  kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2005, Lộc  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lộc  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  P. Thị Gấm (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  N. Thị Tuỳ (42) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  N. Thị Tơ (47) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон - молодой мужчина 1979 года рождения. Женат и отец 1-го ребенка. Даврон занимается производством лепешки а его жена продает их на рынке "Панчшанбе". Даврон закупает муку у оптовиков в запас, чтобы застраховать себя, если завоз муки на время приостановится. У Даврона есть свои постоянные клиенты, которые берут лепешки под реализацию и рассчитываются сразу после реализации. Даврон кредитуется у нас с 2007 года. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Даврон очень благодарен нашей организации за поддержку малого бизнеса населения.
texts.en:
Davron is a young man who was born in 1979. He is married and is the father of 1 child. Davron makes flatbread and his wife sells it at the “Panchshanbe” market. Davron purchases flour from wholesalers in advance in order to provide insurance for himself in case the flour supply stops temporarily. Davron has his own regular customers who take flatbread for resale and pay him right after they sell it. Davron has been our borrower since 2007. He always uses his loans purposefully. Davron is very grateful to our organization for our support of the population’s small businesses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flatbread

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena H. A. vive en el departamento La Libertad. Maria es madre soltera de una hija de 21 años de edad que solo logro cursar hasta el nivel básico de educación, Maria no recibe apoyo económica de nadie, ella sola ha logrado sostener y sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su única hija, Maria se dedica a su negocio que es  una pequeña venta de frutas y golosinas, Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su inventario y así lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena H. A. lives in the department La Libertad. Maria is a single mother of a 21 year-old daughter who only studied until the basic level of education. Maria does not receive any economic support, she alone with much effort has succeeded in maintaining and making her only daughter get ahead. Maria sells fruit and candy for a living. Maria is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her stock and thus achieve higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hochiumar

texts.ru: Хочиумар – пожилой мужчина 59 лет. Женат и отец 6-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, делает работу по дому и присматривает за внуками. Хочиумар как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Гафуров. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего маршрутного такси.
texts.en:
Hochiumar is an older man of 59 years. He is married and the father of six children. His wife is a homemaker; she does housework and looks after the grandchildren. Hochiumar, as the head of the family, works and earns money. He drives a minibus taxi between Khudjand and Gafurov. His work schedule is 2 days of work and one day off. On working days he tries to earn as much as possible by working from early in the morning to late at night. On days off he repairs his vehicle. He would like to use a loan on repairs for his minibus.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transportation services

loans.name: Rosewilyn

texts.en: Rosewilyn T. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Rosewilyn owns and operates a business selling used clothes. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosewilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more used clothes to sell. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en: Panfila C. owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She is 53 years old already and has five children. She was previously engaged in a hog-raising business. She stopped raising pigs because she has less capital to sustain her business. Now, she is busy managing a small store. She sells different goods. She would like to ask a loan of Php 19,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise to sell. She hopes that her loan will be the key to grow her sari-sari store business. In that way, she could easily buy all their family needs. CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Biaziz

texts.ru: Биазиз – 42 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей национальной женской одежды и тканей. Она торгует на рынке Мастчинского района и кроме того она ходит по домам и предлагает платья и ткани женщинам. Биазиз закупает товар из рынка "Сомонбазар" и "Атушбазар" города Худжанда. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Биазиз уже 2 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Биазиз расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию женской обуви. Теперь у Биазиз увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Biaziz is forty-two years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She sells traditional women's clothing and fabrics. She trades in the Mastchoh market and additionally goes door-to-door selling dresses and fabrics to women. Biaziz buys her goods from the markets Somonbazaar and Atushbazaar in the city of Khojand. She goes to buy goods twice a month. Her husband is a master builder. Biaziz has financed her business through us for the last two years. When she began, she had a small quantity of goods. But now Biaziz has expanded her inventory, and with the last loan she bought a lot of women's shoes. Now the variety of Biaziz's goods has increased.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling traditional dresses

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria S., a 53-year-old widow, sells food items in the street, selling different kinds of biscuits, candies and other food items to earn a living. Before, she tried to raise pigs. She was not able to manage it well and decided to stop her business and instead, manage a small stall filled with many foods to sell.

She is asking a loan of Php 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase food items for her business. Now, her business is going so well. She hopes to improve her stall someday.

CEVI help Silveria sustain her business even more. CEVI provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Munire

texts.ru: Мунире – 36 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует с Торговом Центре «Бадри Мунир» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Мунира закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Мунира за свой кредит хочет закупть партию летней женской одежды.
texts.en:
Munire is 36 years old, married and a mother of two children. She makes her living selling women's clothing at the shopping center "Badri Munir" in the district "Panchshanbe" of the city Hudzhanda. Also, every Friday she travels to the "Juma-bazar" market and every Sunday to the "Yakshanbe-bazar". Munira purchases the goods in the city of Bishkek in Kyrgyzstan where she travels to once every month. Her husband works as a builder/contractor. Munira wants to use this loan to purchase a batch of summer clothes wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothes for sale

loans.name: Mahsud

texts.ru: Махсудчон мужчина , который имеет бизнес производства и продажи домашних национальных лепёшек, хлеба. Махсудчон  каждый свой кредит использует на свой бизнес (покупку угля, несколько тонн муки, и.т.д.) Следующий займ он планирует  использовать на закуп небольшой партии муки первого сорта. У него хлеб имеет большой спрос из-за хорошего качества и товарного вида. При каждом мониторинге мы убеждаемся, что у Махсудчона стабильный доход с его бизнеса-производства.
texts.en:
Mahsud owns a business, a bakery, where he bakes special Tajik flatbreads for sale. Every loan that Mahsud had with us he has used to improve his business (purchase of coal, a few tonnes of flour etc.). He is planning to use this loan to purchase a small batch of highest quality flour. Mahsud's flatbreads are very popular due to their excellent quality and appetizing looks. Every time we visit Mahsud we are convinced that his business yields a steady income and is very reliable.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул молодой мужчина 29 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. У него среднее специальное образование. Султонкул занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Султонкул кредитуется 1 год. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Султонкул немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Султонкул планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Sultonkul is a young man of 29 years of age. He is married and has three children. Sultonkul has a professional degree but he makes his living by raising and selling cattle and his wife sells cow milk and milk products as well. He has been working with us for a years. When Sultonkul came to us for the first time he had only a few animals. Now he has expanded his herd a little. However, Sultonkul's wife has only one milk cow and he wants to purchase another milk cow with calf using the money from the current loan. Sultonkul is very grateful to be able to borrow money from us.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Emilene

texts.en:
In 1986, Emilene N. started to plant "Calamansi" or citrus. She is 43 years old now and has four children. Her income from her farm helps her to renovate their house, pay the tuition of her children and buy the things they need.

Emilene would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan buy fertilizers and pesticides. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to grow her farming business.

Through CEVI, she learned to manage a business. CEVI provides not only loans to their clients but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Abduhoshim
