texts.ru: Абдухошим – мужчина средних лет (36 лет), женат и отец 1-го ребенка. У Абдухошима есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Абдухошим каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдухошима пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдухошим за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдухошим очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Abduhoshim is a middle-aged man (36 years old), is married, and the father one child. Abduhoshim has a flock of livestock consisting of approximately 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a housewife and processes wool in her spare time. Every morning, Abduhoshim drives the herd to the mountains, grazes them, and drives them back in the evening. Currently, Abduhoshim does not have enough cattle, but Abduhoshim wants to use this loan to buy two average bulls. After fattening them for three to four months, he can sell them for very good price. Abduhoshim is very glad to work with us because the loans help him very much.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Komilhon

texts.ru: Солихочаев Комилхон- мужчина торгующий на рынке Худжанда, продуктами питания .Он кредитуется четвёртый год , без проблем и нарушений. На каждый займ он пополняет свой бизнес сезонными товарами. Зимой- шоколадом, летом- напитками, мороженым, соками. Поэтому он решил подать очередную заявку на кредит. На снимке Комилхон на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
Komilhon S. is a man who sells food products at the Khujand market. This is his fourth year as a borrower without problems or violations. He uses every loan to add seasonal products to his business; in the winter – chocolate, in the summer – drinks, ice cream, juices. This is why he has decided to apply again for a loan. Komilhon is in the photo at his place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Pania

texts.en:
"Before, I was just a housewife who had no income. I started my sari-sari (variety) store business in 1978. Now, I am still able to manage my business. I want to make good in my business to be able to send and finish all my children in school," says Pania N., the mother of seven children.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to  buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will really help her grow her business. The loan will also help attract more customers as well.

Through CEVI, she is still able to sustain her livelihood. CEVI provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise in her store

loans.name: Muhamadrasul

texts.ru: Мухамадрасулу 50 лет. У него есть жена и 3-е детей. Два сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Мухамадрасул пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он недавно кредитуется в нашей организации, и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
Muhamadrasul is fifty years old. He has a wife and three children, two sons and one daughter. His older sons have left for Russia to work. While working there, they send money to their parents. The parents then save the money for their sons' marriage. Their only daughter helps at home. His wife works spinning yarn. She goes and sells it at the market. Muhamadrasul grazes cattle in the mountains and comes home very late. He has recently taken out loans through our organization, and is a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito L. is from the village of Biasong. She is 42 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. Charito owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. In 2004, Charito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Charito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Makhmud

texts.ru: Махмуду 30 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. У него высшее образование. Махмуд занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Махмуд кредитуется пол года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Махмуда немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Махмуд планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Makhmud is thirty years old. He is married and the father of two children. He has a higher education. Makhmud works fattening and selling livestock. His wife works processing and selling milk. Makhmud has been taking out loans for half a year. When he came to take out a loan for the first time, he had few animals. Now, Makhmud has increased the number of animals in his flock. His wife has only one milk cow. Makhmud plans to buy one more milk cow and calf for his wife, and it is grateful to our lenders for help in bringing his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
"I started my business in 1999. I have only have Php 15,000 in savings that I use to buy goods to sell. My neighbors come in everyday to buy what they need. I have been grateful to see how my small store has grown. The income that I get is used to pay for the education of my nephews, since I am still single," says this fifty-eight-year old entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will help expand her business and attract more customers. 

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sayada Group

texts.en:
Sayada is the group leader of Sayada group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. They want to expand and progress their businesses.

Sayada and Sameira want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They want to open a new shop for their business. Nasrin wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of a general store. He wants to make his business larger. Arozo wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling fresh fruit.

They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru: Солибой пожилой мужчина 67 лет. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Солибой занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Солибоя – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Солибой экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Солибой продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Soliboy is an elderly 67 year old man. He is married and is the father of 6 children. His wife does not have a job. She stays at home and does the housework and feeds the livestock. Soliboy fattens and sells livestock. The start of summer is the season to purchase livestock for Soliboy because in the spring livestock and feed are cheap and you do not need to pay a lot to fatten livestock. The livestock eats the mountain grass and Soliboy can save on the livestock feed. With the start of winter Soliboy sells part of the fattened livestock, but he does not purchase livestock. He purchases feed to fatten the leftover livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.ru: Очилова Бихосият женщина , которая торгует при входе в Городскую больницу хлебом и мелкими продуктами питания. Бихосият хочет купить по изготовлению молочного кактейля. Она кредитуется уже третий год, и довольна условиями и обслуживанием сотрудников Фонда. Бихосият на снимке в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Bihosiyat O. is a woman who sells bread and miscellaneous food products in front of the entrance to the city hospital. Bihosiyat will use the loan to make milk shakes. She has been a borrower for three years now and is happy with the terms and the service of Fund workers. Bihosiyat is in the photo on the day that she received her loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of bread and food products

loans.name: Pann

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Pann K. and her husband. Pann K. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of five children. All five of them are teenagers and are attending the local secondary school. Pann K. currently sells fresh fish caught by her husband as well as some bought from her wholesale supplier. She earns approximately $5 each day to put toward her family's daily expenses. Pann K. has requested a loan of $700 for her husband to purchase additional fish tools for the approaching fishing season.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish tools

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Очилова Рохат, женщина которая занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сама она работает кондитером в кондитерском цехе. Но кроме этого она каждый воскресный базар вместе с мужем выходит на рынок скота и занимается бизнесом купли и продажи мелкорогатого скота. Рохат уже третий год кредитуется в Фонде и благодарна инвесторам за предоставившую возможность иметь дополнительный доход с бизнеса животноводства. На снимке Рохат у кассы в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Rohat O. is a woman who works buying and selling livestock. She works as a confectioner in a confectionery shop. But each Sunday she and her husband go to the livestock market to buy and sell sheep and goats. This is the third year Rohat has financed her business, and she is grateful to investors for giving her the opportunity to create additional income from animal husbandry. In the picture, Rohat is at the cashier's desk for her loan dispensation.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling livestock

loans.name: Mutriba

texts.ru: Мутриба молодая женщина, мать двоих детей, самостоятельная бизнесменка, которая сама ездит за товаром в Бишкек и продаёт на рынках города Худжанда. Она продаёт все постельные товары, подушки из лебяжьего пуха, покрывала из верблюжьей шерсти, полотенца высшего качества и.т.д. Для расширения ассортимента бизнеса Мутриба хочет получить очередной кредит. На снимке Мутриба в день подачи заявки на займ.
texts.en:
Mutriba is a young woman and is the mother of two children; she is an independent businesswoman who travels by herself to Bishkek for products and sells them at the markets in the city of Khujand. She sells all kinds of bed products: pillows made with swan feathers, blankets made from camel wool, the highest quality towels, etc. In order to grow the product assortment of her business Mutriba would like to get another loan. Mutriba is in the photo on the day that she applied for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of pillows, blankets

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
"Before, I was just a plain housewife who stayed at the house and earned no income. Because of that, I started my seaweed farm. My husband and I have been engaged in this seaweed business in order to be able to satisfy the needs of our three children," says Teresita A., thirty-seven-year-old entrepreneur from Bien Unido, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to buy seedlings for her seaweed farm. In doing so, she believes that she will be able to improve her farm and earn better income for her family.

CEVI helps seaweed growers in Bien Unido to better maintain their standard of living. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen's business is a family business where she works with her husband. The business is an art shop where Nisreen's husband paints pictures and signs, writes in Arabic in a special artistic way for special events, and decorates vases with colors and flowers.

Nisreen's husband started the business a few years ago with only two US dollars.  After he lost all hope of finding a job, in spite of having finished his university degree, he used the two dollars to buy markers, coloring pens and papers. His work was successful. Then he got married and now he has three boys, aged 10, 2, and 1 years old. With the help of his wife the business grew quickly. There was high demand from the market, so Nisreen was responsible for decorating the vases with flowers and selling to customers while her husband was responsible for the painting.

During the last war in Gaza in late-December 2008 and early-January 2009, Nisreen lost her business when it was bombed. She and her husband lost everything -- raw materials, inventory, etc. -- but they never lost hope and they intend to continue working under any condition, especially now that they have children. 

The family approched FATEN's branch in Jabalia for a business loan in the amount of 2000 USD, since they had already signed with UNRWA (United Nations Relief and Works Agency) to provide materials, painting and signs for the summer camps the UN conducts for refugees.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fazal Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Fazal M. is the leader of the Fazal M. group, which has four members. They have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani.

Fazal M. wants a loan for his butcher shop. He will enlarge his shop. 

Pacha G. wants to take a loan for his business of mobile materials. He will expand and progress his business. 

M. Fazal wants a loan for his  vegetable business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. 

A. Qahar wants a loan to expand his general store. 

These four men say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for business

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en:
Jo-an D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is twenty-four years old and married with two  infant-aged children. To make a living, Jo-an owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jo-an has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jo-an joined one of Kiva's field partners, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jo-an has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Jo-an is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jo-an from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is forty years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $43 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Conchita joined PMPC, one of Kiva's field partners, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to increase her product offerings. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok C. is a sixty-six year old mother of three children who are single and still living in the family home. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for the children. The family's daily expenses are paid  by Sok C.'s husband who works maintaining a public garden. Another income source comes from their two daughters who work as garment workers for a factory. Recently, heavy rains fell, affecting the family's house with bad water, which is harmful to their health. Because of the problem, Sok C. has decided to ask for a loan of $1200 to purchase a piece of land to surround the house. The remainder of the loan will be used to build a hedge around her house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to surround the house

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en: "I started selling food in 2006. I only had Php 6,000 capital back then and that is what I used to continue doing business. My business is located in Bilang-bilangan, an island in Trinidad, Bohol. My income from my business is what I use to pay our daily expenses at home," says Ma. Bona B., a 38-year old mother of two children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 16,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for her food business. In doing so, Ma. Bona thinks that she will be able to improve their livelihood. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
“Persevere to become successful,” says Julie R.. This saying motivates Julie to work very hard for her family. Her family lives in the village of Bonfal Proper in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished high school and is doing her best and is determined to become successful someday through patience, hard work and with the support of her husband Wagner. They have two children.

Julie sells fish in their village while her husband sells coconuts. They earn enough to educate their children. Because of their desire to improve their business, Julie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 as additional working capital. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders as believes the loan will help increase her standard of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Magielyn

texts.en:
According to Magielyn, she has to prioritize for the future of her children. Her husband is Mario V. and together with their children, her family happily lives in Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She makes a lot of sacrifices to support the studies of their children to give them a better future someday. Despite their financial difficulties in life, they still have the desire to give their children the best education possible.

Furniture making is a popular source of income in the village. Her husband used to work a local business making tables, chairs, cabinets and even sala set. This gave them the idea to open up their own furniture business. Because they lack financial capital to expand their business, Magielyn is seeking the assistance of KIVA lenders.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 for their business. Magielyn hopes to purchase more furniture materials and wood needed for the continuous operation of their business.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old. Bonifacia is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Bonifacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Bonifacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

---------------------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife M. is a resident of Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is an industrious woman and is married to Rolando M.. They have been blessed with six children. Due to lack financial resources two children decided not to pursue their college studies. One of them works as laborer and the other is training to become a soldier. Her other children are in elementary school. Though life can be difficult, the couple strives to give their younger children the best education possible.

Marife is seeking the support of lenders to finance her vending business in their rural village. She requests to PHP 15,000. She sells “buko” (coconut) at Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Marife is able to earn an average income of PHP 3,000 every month. She wants to improve her business so her children can continue to receive an education. Marife believes that through the assistance of lenders she can accomplish her goals.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jawed

texts.en: Jawed is the son of S. D.. He is 22 years old, single, and lives in district of 12 Kabul Afghanistan. There are four other members in his household and all of them benefit from his income. He owns a general store where he sells different kinds of goods. He would like to expand his business by buying more products to sell. Hence he is requesting a loan of 50,000 Afghanis. He is very happy about this small loan process in Afghanistan that wants to help poor people.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando I., “Rolly” lives in the rural village of Bonfal Proper in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He finished high school but unfortunately was not able to pursue college, due to financial constraints. During those times, he helped his parents earn a living until he married Virginia, his wife. They were blessed with three children. Despite their current difficulties, Rolando is doing his best to send all of his children to school. He doesn’t want them experience what he suffered through.

He uses his tricycle transport to earn a living, but was not able to satisfy their basic needs. Virginia works as a domestic helper in Hong Kong. Rolly wants to increase his income to support the studies of their children so he is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 from ASKI. The money will be used to maintain his tricycle.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
“Nowadays, we are struggling from economic crisis, and sometimes we felt hopeless,” said Virginia. But according to her, “be patient and you will survive”.

Virginia was only able to attend primary school when she was a child but she does everything she can to provide her family with a better standard of living. Virginia is determined to become a successful entrepreneur by being patient and hardworking. Virginina is married to Francisco A. Jr. and they live happily at Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

With regard to their source of work, Virginia manages a general store while her husband operates a tricycle transport business. With their daily income from their businesses, the couple is able to support the education of their child. Virginia is asking to borrow PHP 15,000 as additional working capital. She hopes her business can expand for their future welfare.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
"When we got married, my husband and I started a seaweed farm in Hingotanan Island," says Caren B.. Before that she worked as a saleslady. The income that they get from seaweed is what they use to feed their children and pay for family needs. Caren, 26, is a mother of two children.

Caren is asking a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional seedlings for seaweed farming. She hopes that her loan will help her get better harvests.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Buy seedlings for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“Family unity fights poverty,” says Elizabeth M. of Barangay Nagcuartelan in Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to the prevailing economic crisis that is happening globally, Elizabeth and her husband help each other to sustain their livelihood and provide the basic needs of their family, especially the education of their two children.

Her husband patiently maintains their rice and vegetable farming business while Elizabeth diligently works in her tailoring business. She makes dresses, curtains and uniforms. Her wish is to have a progressive business and that she can borrow PHP8, 000.00.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
With strong faith and determination, Melody is hoping to achieve her goals in life. She aims to become a successful dressmaker. She pursued her vocational studies in dress making, which is now of great help to her family.

She is happily married to Antonio and blessed with three children. They live in Barangay Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple is providing for the needs of their family and in sending their youngest child to college. Two are already college graduates.

Melody's husband is a passenger driver. She is asking for financial support amounting to PHP10, 000.00 for her tailoring business. With the loan she hopes to make uniforms and pants. Melody wants to improve her business, but she has inadequate capital. She hopes to strengthen her business with financial assistance and with her strong determination will grow and become a successful dressmaker.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita E. manages a small store. She is 40 years old and has three children. Her husband, Gilbert E. is a seaweed farmer. Their retail and farming businesses provide for all of their needs.

She would like a loan of Php 23,000 from CEVI. Anecita will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will also help buy seedlings for their seaweeds farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and seedlings.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
“Hard work paves the way to progress,” said Merlinda. She is engaged in the direct-sales business, selling NATASHA and AVON products that she purchases from nearby outlets and sells in their village. She is the industrious housewife of Salvie and the mother of five children. Two of their children are already college graduates while some are still in the tertiary and secondary levels of education. 

Merlinda is applying for a loan of PHP17,000 for her direct-selling business. Her husband works abroad and she wants to help him with meeting the needs of their family and with sending their children to school. She hopes that her business will become fruitful for their welfare. Merlinda believes that patience and hard work will pave her way to success.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla N. is popularly known by her nickname which is “Villa“ in Barangay Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Renato Sr. and they are gifted with three children: Renato Jr., Renante, and Revelyn. Two of them have already graduated from college and are presently applying for a job, while the youngest is still studying in the tertiary level. Servilla hopes that all of them will someday become successful in their professions for she knows that their success is also her success, too, because she really sacrifices a lot for them. 

Servilla manages a vegetable-vending business. She is requesting to borrow PHP 7,000 as additional working capital. Her daily income was utilized for their household’s expenditures and for the studies of her youngest child. She also is hoping that her business becomes progressive and stable.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Ronanisa

texts.en: Ronanisa T. is only 23 years old. She has one child and is married to Dolphy T., a seaweed farmer. It seems just yesterday that she was studying in school. Now, she worries so much how to budget their limited income. She has a seaweed farm. Her husband is the one managing their business. Their income is what they use to buy the needs of their family. She would like to ask a loan of Php 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional seedlings for their seaweed farm. She hopes that she will be able to grow their farm. In that way, she could easily pay all the expenses at home. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional seedlings for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight adult children. Vicenta owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vicenta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is 34 years old and married to Vivian, his business partner in their photo copier shop located along Bachelor Street in Dubinan East Santiago City just in front of the University of La Salette, where most of their customers are teachers and students. They have been engaged in this business for almost eight years.

Since technology is becoming more advanced, Gerry is requesting a loan of PHP 50, 000 to buy materials and an upgraded Xerox machine. This loan will enable his business to grow and become more stable for the future of their children. He is hoping that his request will be granted.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Bachelor St. Dubinan East,Santiago City, Isabela

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: "I started having a store using my small savings of php 4,000. With the help of CEVI, I was able to sustain my business until now. My income from my store is what I use to help my husband raise our three children," says Luciana S., an entrepreneur from Bien Unido, Bohol. Luciana would like to ask for a loan of Php 25,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. She thinks that the loan will really help her attract more customers and could increase her income as well. CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia is engaged in rice farming. She is already 49 years old and is married to Delfin C.. The couple is thankful for having been blessed with three children: Lexington - 27 years old, a college undergraduate; Lora Laine - 18 years old, second year in college; and Lexter - 14 years old, second year high school. Aside from helping her husband in their farming business, Remigia is also engaged in the direct selling business of Natasha, MSE and Avon products.

Remigia wanted to borrow PHP 12,000 from ASKI as additional capital for their rice-farming business. She is hoping that she can obtain the loan for it will really assist them in their farming needs. She believes that her family will overcome the difficulties of life.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Farming is the major source of income in the village of Pangal Norte in Echague, Isabela, where Roberto has been managing his rice field for almost ten years. He wants to develop his business but due to lack of capital he cannot afford all of the farm inputs he needs. He is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 12,000.00 from the lenders as additional working capital.

With this business alone, Roberto is able to support his family. He is now 36 years old and his wife Anita is an elementary school teacher in their village. He is hoping that his loan request will be approved for it will of great help towards achieving the sustainability of his farming business. He also believes that aside from having enough capital, patience and hard work are essential factors in the success of every business endeavor.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: "After I resigned my previous job, I got married and we had three children. On the same date, I also started to grow seaweed. The income that I get from my farm has helped a lot in providing the needs of my wife as well as my children," says Wilfredo T., an entrepreneur and father of three children. He would like to ask for a loan of Php 25,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional seedlings for his seaweed farm. The loan will really help him improve their family income. CEVI aims to help small businesss to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional seedlings for his seaweed farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is 28 years old and single without a child. He has a shop where he sells phone accessories.  He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 63 years old, married, and has six adult children. Fely owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Fely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products
